Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: A. McFarlane
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!  I bought it based on the reviews I read, but had NO idea of all the different things this camera does!  It shoots videos and it shoots in "sports mode" - taking many pictures one right after the other so you don't miss anything. We have used this camera at some multiple-day music festivals and are simply amazed at the clarity of the pictures and how easy it is to use!  The sound on the videos is good (if your computer speakers are good) and a unipod solves the shake problem if you have one.  The batteries last pretty long if you aren't shooting videos - that seems to use them up quicker.  This is my first digital camera, and I bought it because 1) easy to use, 2) large preview screen and 3) uses AA batteries.  I was absolutely thrilled it did all this extra stuff.  Friends who took the same pictures with their cameras were surprised at the difference when the pictures were posted.  Ours were much better.  Highly recommend this camera - especially to the camera novice (like me).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: A. White "mustang"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading all the + reviews on several web sites. This is a very good camera for the price.Pro's: price, simple to use, slips right into you shirt pocket or purse, very good pictures, bright LCD (sorry Kodak), uses AA batteries, good video.Con's: none! I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mccarthy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera.  The macro feature is the reason I got this camera and it's great for taking pictures of my aquarium.  The sports mode works great for capturing fish.  It's super easy to use.The only con is that there are many possible settings and most of them are pretty specific.  If you get the wrong setting, then pictures will look odd (strange colors or incorrect focus).  However, these were very specific situations (like the aquarium) and once I figured out which setting to use, it works great.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera but there are better options.
Reviews.Author: starrlit56
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the Coolpix S203 and LOVED it. Good quailty pictures, chargeable battery and very slim.  Super easy to carry around.  When it got wet and died I wanted to replace it with the same model.  Alas, it is no longer made.  So, because I enjoyed my first Nikon Coolpix, I bought the L22 and was completly dissapointed.  It seemed HUGE compared to my tiny S203 and the pictures were always blurry.  It took extra seconds to switch from camera to movie and even to take a simple posed picture required 2.5 seconds of holding the button.  Not a chance you would ever catch a good candid shot.  I returned it and bought the S3000.  Best idea and worth the extra $15.  Plus this one does not require AA batteries like the L22.

Reviews.Title: This is my favorite "on the go" camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Beckett
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for everyday use, vacation shots, sports photos, and more. We take low-light, no flash photos with this on the "sports" setting for dance recitals and plays. The photos turn out terrific, and people always ask what camera we use because they are so impressed with the clarity of the shots.This camera has numerous features and settings. The navigation between settings is pretty intuitive, and the instruction manual has lots more ideas too. It has good video capability for capturing something in a video file when you don't have a camcorder handy. You don't need special software to upload photos from this camera - I have a card reader in my computer to do all that.The camera does a good job conserving battery life. We use rechargeable AA batteries without any problems for hundreds of photos per charge. It's compact and fairly lightweight, and it fits into a shirt pocket with ease.The large screen makes reviewing photos easy, and deleting ones from the camera is simple with just a touch of a button plus an "are you sure?" question to keep you from potentially erasing something in error.The 3.6x optical zoom is an improvement over the previous Nikon Coolpix we had, so this is now the favorite camera in my home! If you've had a Coolpix in the past and are thinking about getting a newer version, definitely do it! You'll find the operations and menu choices very similar to what you're used to, but with added improvements that you'll appreciate.We've not had any problems with the battery cover on this camera or the previous Coolpix cameras we still own. If you break the battery cover, it's time for a new camera, unfortunately. But it's very sturdy and reliable, so we've never worried about it much.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: L. Runkle
Reviews.Content: I simply LOVE this camera.  I am an over 50 year old artist. I wanted good quality pictures but I don't really understand the new technology.  This camera is so easy to use and gets the quality I want in the pictures.  You can even adjust certain elements to improve the picture even more to your liking.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: yankeefan81
Reviews.Content: I'm a very loyal Nikon fan and have been using their digital SLR cameras for years.  My "bar" camera has always been a Canon, but I decided to try the Nikon Coolpix since I have always trusted Nikon's technology.The camera takes nice pictures and is a very good price for a 12 megapixel camera.  There is a large view screen, which is also a plus.However, there are two major downsides to the camera that I wish I would have known before purchasing:1) It uses AA batteries -- NOT a rechargeable battery pack.  This actually makes the camera more expensive in the long run, since you need to constantly purchase AA batteries.  It also makes the camera wider than battery-pack cameras since there has to be room for batteries.  Hence, a camera that doesn't fit in your pocket as well as other models2) After hitting the shutter button, it takes a LONG time for the camera to actually take the picture.  So being out at the bar, everyone has to wait a LONG time holding their smiles... almost uncomfortably long.  So this camera is not recommended for use at sporting events where you are trying to capture fast-action motion

Reviews.Title: Ease of use
Reviews.Author: Gardengirl "Shar"
Reviews.Content: I am no "techie", but this camera is user friendly and takes beautiful pictures. It does all the adjustments automaticly. If you want a "point & shoot", no-brainer I recommend this camera. AND it is "pretty".

Reviews.Title: Best camera for baby photos for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Goeller "AussieDO"
Reviews.Content: This camera has been a lifesaver. We were taking photos with our cell phones and they were good, but after getting a professional photo session and seeing the difference in quality (and the package costing an arm and a leg) we decided to get a camera of our own. The quality is outstanding! It is effortless to take portrait photos, make videos, snap a picture once a smile appears, and shoot panoramic shots. I am so glad we got this camera (the color is cute too!)

Reviews.Title: Got what I wanted at this price
Reviews.Author: Morris Luk
Reviews.Content: If you are on a very very tight budget (air ticket took the most part of my budget already) and don't want to pay anything over $100, this is the camera for this price.  Below is my feedback after taking a couple of hundred pictures in a trip to Hong Kong.Pros:-low price-pictures are of good quality (12mega) and over 95% of them were in good focus and clear.  I printed about 150 pics (including Disney World in HK) on photo paper thru PhotoMax in Hong Kong for Mom in law and they came out very well.  They look good on computer too.-took about 10 video clips.  They all worked well on computer when replaying (the camera does not have HD format support yet in its video).-use AA batteries (I know some people do not like this as it makes the camera a little bigger - anyway just a little bigger only and OK with me) but I like it because if the battery runs out by accident and I have no replacement handy, I can purchase anywhere easily.  BTW, I had 4 rechargeable AA batteries and this camera took 2 at a time and so most of the time I did not run into the need to buy new battery.  You can take a lot of pics with just 2 batteries.  The only one time we had to purchase new batteries was because we forgot to bring the other 2 batteries out and the ones in use ran out.  This is much better than when a camera is using other type of batteries and you forgot to bring them out and you won't be able to use your camera in that case at all.-flash is OKCons:-the mode that has face detection just does not work.  If you use that mode, the pictures you got would be extremely extremely disappointing and that's why some other reviews here said that the pictures from this camera were very poor and this was because they probably have selected that mode.  If you stay away from using that and select other mode, the picture would come out just fine.  With that said, you are not really getting all the features that you pay for here.  Even this camera is cheap, the price per each working function may be more expensive than the others.  But too bad, I cannot spend more than $100 for a camera in my budget and so I have to stick with it (still better than not being able to get a camera at all).-the sports mode is only 1/250th second and its much slower than most of other camera (1/1000th second).So if you cannot afford more than $100 like me and you only care about taking reasonable good pictures easily (no sports - sports mode is slow), this may be the right camera for you.  If you can spend more than $100, you should check out something else and you can get better sports mode and higher zoom power, etc.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Really great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my teenage sons and it has performed beyond expectations. Image quality is really good even at night and I love the panoramic picture feature. I love the fact that it uses AA batteries.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: simply cool
Reviews.Author: P. Craig
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good in quality and small in design. It meets all the requirements I was looking for and does a beutiful job that lives up to its ads. I have always enjoyed Nikon cameras and the zoom fits in perfectly for my needs.

Reviews.Title: A delightful little camera.
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I just finished putting this camera through it's paces, and I am thoroughly impressed. It truly is a point-and-shoot camera, taking roughly a second to snap a picture. The menus and settings are very intuitive, and there seems to be a setting for every occasion. Close ups, parties, outdoors, sports, and lots lots more, even a built in panorama assist! The included software, Panorama Maker 5, has allowed me to make some scenes that look very professional. Closeups are very sharp, but it does take a little maneuvering to make the camera focus on the object you want, rather than bringing the background into focus instead. The end result is splendid, so the extra effort isn't all that bad of a price to pay.The only reason I gave this camera 4 stars is the fact that it's a bit of a battery hog. After an hour or so of shooting, it has already drained the two AA's to 65%. (When you hook the camera up to your computer, it tells you the remaining battery life and memory! Neat!!!)I would highly recommend this camera to anybody, for the price it is an -absolute- steal!

Reviews.Title: Freaking awesome!
Reviews.Author: C. Pitt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It just came in today and I've been playing with the macro, and all I have to say is, HOLY CRAP IT IS AMAZING! I like to take really close shots of small things and this camera is perfect for that. I had the L18 until I completely killed it, and the buttons are pretty much the same but in different places. The menu is really easy to follow, and the screen is a good size for the size of the camera. Let me just say WOW this camera is shiny! I'd definitely recommend getting a case!

Reviews.Title: Very mediocre photo results. Video quality is better. Several intermittent issues.
Reviews.Author: Abhinav Agarwal "AA"
Reviews.Content: Hugely disappointing camera. Mediocre flash photo results, purple fringes, severe noise in low light, and intermittent issues. Positives are good video results, bright LCD screen, and good-enough results in bright light. The battery compartment latch is useless, and has to be held together with a rubberband.This is my first Nikon camera. The combination of the price and the fact that it is a Nikon led me to purchase this camera. I have been using Canon cameras for 15+ years, and was very eager to try this barebones point-and-shoot Nikon. Needless to say, it has been a huge disappointment. Maybe I got a lemon, or maybe at the price this is the best I should expect to get.The positives:- Cute size.- Attractive red color.- LCD screen is bright.- Video results are good.- No settings to tinker around with, so a good option for someone looking for a simple camera.Negatives- The latch that holds the AA batteries in the hold is flimsy. The grip that holds the latch shut is so thin that the latch pops open at the slightest touch. You need to use a rubberband to hold the latch in place.- Photo results are very mediocre. In bright light the results are ok, but you can see a purple tinge at the edges. In low light the results are very grainy. The graininess is the result of the camera automatically choosing a high ISO rating.- In low light the flash does not do a good job of adequate lighting.- The photos look to be very much on the soft side. It's either that or they look out of focus.- Sometimes the camera just does not shoot. You have to switch off and switch on the camera back to take a photo.Nonetheless, for those looking for a basic digital P&S; I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Those other reviewers are trying to trick you
Reviews.Author: Nightside
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the good reviews. I bought this camera for two basic reasons. I like using AA batteries because I always have the rechargeable ones at my house. I don't need a special camera charger. I can just grab batteries and go. Never have to wait. And #2 was because of the great ratings on Amazon.But I was tricked.There is way too long of a delay when switching between modes, the pictures come out blurry 8 out of 10 times, the colors on the LCD screen do not match the colors on the actual picture, the flash whitewashes everything.When you normally see a camera flash you think "I'm done, now I can move." But not so with this thing. There is this slight delay. When the subjects think the picture was taken, the camera is still taking the picture, but they have started moving, and then it comes out blurry. But you don't see the result of the picture for about another 1 or 2 seconds. But by that time most of your people have already gone on with their lives. Now you have to ask them to pose again.Then you have color issues. The LCD screen is the viewfinder and you will see a yellow tinted picture, but then the actual picture will come out brighter, especially with the flash. The flash just overpowers and washes out everything.Also, the image stablizers cause a delay in what you see on the screen as compared to real life. As if the processor is running too slow. What is on the screen is about half a second off from real time, and is a bit choppy. They should have stuck with the viewfinder.We used the camera for 1 week and realized it was just worthless, and we are returning it. Either the camera is defective or the design is just cra- not well thought out- p.Here were some common phrases said while using the camera:"Wait, can you guys come back the picture came out blurry.""Oh you moved too much""Wow  the flash is too strong""Sorry, it takes like 2 seconds to snap"It is horrible for those candid shots. We ended up using our camera phones.So go right out and buy one today and give it as a gift to someone you hate. Merry Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Nice looking camera; TERRIBLE design and TERRIBLE service
Reviews.Author: Erin's mom
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas.  I put the batteries in and the door would not close.  I sent it to Nikon to be repaired, as it was broken when I opened the box. Apparently a VERY SMALL pin was broken.Nikon says the repair is not covered under warranty; the repairs are $73.00.  The camera was $90.00I would not recommend this camera AT ALL.  I should have stuck with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera :-)
Reviews.Author: Eric Champine
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that my last camera was a 3.5 MP and it was good for what I used it for but I let it bounce off the floor one to many times and it has died. That is when I started to look around for other easy to use good quality cameras. I looked at a lot of my friends cameras and started to read all the reviews.One of my friends had the Nikon L20 and he loved it. I tried it out too and loved it but I then found out that the L22 was replacing the L20. I asked around and found a friend that had the Nikon L22 and he let me use it for a weekend. What a very nice camera. It did everything I wanted it to do and then some. All the pictures and videos looked awesome to me and I did not have one problem with it at all. All the pics were sharp and focused. What more could you want? East to get batteries! Yup this camera uses AA batteries and I had a boat load of them. Everything in my house seems to use AA batteries so a long time ago I switched everything in my house to rechargeable NiMH AA batteries. They last forever in this camera. Say if you were at a wedding or something and your batteries run out. Just go to your local corner store and get a few easy to find AA batteries or just bring a few extra from home. Life is easy for me. I hate the proprietary batteries that come with most cameras. The other good thing about this camera is it uses standard SD and SDHC memory cards. I got a 8GB SDHC card for $19.00 bucks. It gave me something like 2,200 available pics to take at 12MP. Needless to say I purchased this camera in sliver from Amazon.com and I take it everywhere with me. Remember it is a $100.00 dollar camera and not a $500.00 dollar camera. It doesn't have all the high end features like touch screen but it has everything I want and it takes really nice pics. I don't think you'll go wrong with the Nikon L22. Get it. Trust me :-)

Reviews.Title: Coolpox L22
Reviews.Author: Daniel Hollander "DCH"
Reviews.Content: The transaction was super easy and the camera is even better than expected!  I use a Nikon DSLR and have been nothing but happy with it.  I needed a new point & shoot for work, and this one is a winner for the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift!
Reviews.Author: Bean Counter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 70 year old mother hoping it would prove easy to use and non-intimidating.  It was perfect.  She loved the look of it, how small it is and the large viewer.  She was able to load the software and start using it immediately. Picture quality was great, too.  Haven't gotten into the more advanced features but for an entry level introduction to digital photography this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Partially disappointed
Reviews.Author: Artrina
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I were on vacation when our camera started to act up on us. We went to a chain store we trust and bought this camera based on the Nikon reputation, the fact that it takes AA batteries and uses the same storage media as the one we currently have. That night I checked out the different settings until I became comfortable changing them. While using it both hubby and I found we switched to pix review with our thumbs often. When we got home I downloaded the pix. We're happy with the ones taken close and on land, but, the ones taken on boats (we went on a couple of sailboats on vacation) and the ones taken at a distance I'm disappointed with. It seems like most of the boat pix are blurry; the seas weren't choppy. I don't think this will take good pix at our grandsons ball games, either.I'm now in the process of researching a camera with some type of stabilization feature and one with a longer optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!...an update 10-17-2010...
Reviews.Author: J. Russell "motorpsiclist"
Reviews.Content: See updated comment below.For the money you can't beat this little camera...for the folks who are complaining about blurry photos, this isn't a $1,000 DSLR...there is some shutter lag, as with all inexpensive digital cameras; take that into account and you'll be fine:  so far I haven't had any difficulties capturing crisply and clearly the smoke rising from my BBQ grill (it helps if you use the right shooting mode for the right shot, too; for that I used the sports/action mode).  The micro mode is great!  Another thing that helps prevent blurry photos is to use a tripod!  Especially if you're shooting important landscapes or portraits.  (Helpful hint:  when using a tripd you may want to turn image stabilization off...try a shot both ways and see which you prefer.)  As for battery usage...most cameras eat batteries if you're shooting a lot, which is why every photography book/course/instructor/owner's manual tells you:  carry extra batteries!  Now let's talk video...I am so delighted with the great videos this little camera makes!  I had a small digital camera which I paid half again as much for, and my Nikon takes better videos.  Again, folks, this isn't a $1,000 DSLR; don't expect it to be, and you won't be disappointed.  I highly, highly recommend this camera!  It goes with me everywhere I go, and it has not disappointed me yet as I put it through its paces.UPDATE:  10-17-2010:  I took this little camera to Biketoberfest, and in the sports/action mode using a panning technique I got crystal clear photos of the bikes as they went by me.  I shot several movies and the sound was awesome, and the movies are sharp as a tack!  The batteries, which I have had in the camera since I bought it, lasted all day and were still going strong.  The micro mode is very impressive...you can get as close as 2" to your subject.  The more I use this camera, the more I'm impressed with it and happy I bought it!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: P. Deshpande "traveling math nerd"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 weeks ago. Now I am in Tuscany for work, I have been taking pictures of all my weekend trips. This has proven to be an amazing camera.Easy to use, no complications, starts in an instant. It has taken great pictures I love it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera.  Images blurry.
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Meaghan
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th Nikon Coolpix that I purchased.  I owned the Coolpix L6 and liked it very much.  The L6 was a great little camera to have in your pocket or purse.  It took great photos.  The only bad thing - which was big - that I didn't like about that camera was the shutter lag on flash photos.  In spite of that, I liked the small size and very nice photos.  I purchased two more as gifts.  Unfortunately, I dropped mine and wanted to replace it. I purchased the L22 and took it to a wedding.  Out of 50 photos, I only have one nice one.  I tried it in the garden both on regular and on macro - again did not perform well.  Most photos are blurry.  Thank goodness for the great return policy at Amazon.com!  I will be selecting another camera soon.

Reviews.Title: Depends on what you want
Reviews.Author: Rocky Baker
Reviews.Content: First off I am a big fan of Nikon. I own three Nikon DSLR's and really like them all.As of a few months ago I owned one Nikon L3 point and shoot camera and one Canon A720 IS P&S; camera. The Canon seemed to be much better and I had a little cash to spare so I bought the newer version of each, a Nikon L22 and a Canon A1100 IS. For what I want, the Canon is much better.The Nikon isn't a bad camera, but it isn't what I want in a camera. There are not enough manual controls. You can see from a picture of the camera that it does not have the big button function selector on top. You are a slave to the Nikon menu's and they don't have nearly the number of choices that I want. There is no Program shooting mode, just Auto. Therefore it will not allow me to choose the ISO setting, which is improtant to me. Like most P&S; cameras it does not have a viewfinder so you are left to hold the camera out one or two feet away from you to shoot the picture. I want a viewfinder to look through so that my head helps hold the camera steady, which is VERY improtant in taking a picture with any kind of camera. Some, but not all, of the Canon P&S; cameras do have a viewfinder.If you can get past the limitations of auto selected ISO settings and can hold the camera steady, there is no problem with picture quality. My guess is that a lot of people who don't know as much as I do about digital cameras would love the simplicity of the L22, and the L22 is 40-50 bucks cheaper than most Canon P&S; cameras so it just depends on what you want in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son's birthday.  He loves it. He can take videos and download them to the computer. It takes great pictures.  It is a great little camera and Im very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far so good for a beginner as me
Reviews.Author: FaithAlone "FaithAlone"
Reviews.Content: Happy with my selection (Nikon Coolpix L22 3.6x). I haven't owned a camera in years, so the user-friendly set up was appreciated. In turning on the camera, it takes you through simple steps. Still learning, but so far snapping indoor photos has worked well. To note, the black hard-carrying case suggested for this camera is great quality, but fits the camera very tightly. I'm worried about damaging the camera getting it in-and-out of the case. Also, wish the case had enough room for spare batteries.Goodluck to all in your search!

Reviews.Title: Terrible Focus
Reviews.Author: FamilyLost "yliser"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the price (on sale at purchase) and because it's so cute.  However, out of 50 pictures only about 15 - 20 come out.  The pics are blurry and it takes too long to focus.  No chance of taking a pic quickly with this camera.  I've missed some great moments and all too frequently have to depend on pics taken by friends because mine are just a blur.  I must admit that when the pics are focused they come out beautiful, but I would not recommend purchasing.  It is not reliable.  Also, make sure you have spare batteries with you - they drain pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: Returning it after only one trip!  DO NOT BELIEVE THE REVIEWS
Reviews.Author: Hollie Justice "Holliewd"
Reviews.Content: This was a good price, but most of the pictures are blurry and it takes FOREVER to snap a shot!  You hold the button for a very long time before it will even click a picture.  Not worth the little it cost and I will return it promptly.  Kind of ruined my vacation pics for trying to get a decent picture.  Definitely is talked up more on the reviews than it is worth.  I got it because of the great reviews...why dont you guys say anything about the crappy shots and delay in snapping shots?thanks

Reviews.Title: Nikon L22 Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Bear 57
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Italy after using 3 cameras to shoot what turned out to be mostly landscape-type shots. I used a a Nikon d90, a Sony a55, and this camera, a Blue Nikon l22 Coolpix, which stayed in my pocket for ALL the trip, and I am very happy to report after reviewing over 600 shots on the L22 Coolpix, THIS $95.00 POCKET CAMERA IS AMAZING!!!!!!!! 1- YOU HAVE TO HOLD THE CAMERA STEADY, 2- DON'T EXPECT ALOT FROM THE ZOOM FULLY EXTENDED, 3- USE THE AUTO MODE IF YOU HAVE ANY DOUBTS, 4-DON'T EXPECT PERFECTION IN LOW-LIGHT CONDITIONS, (although I did get some totally amazing outdoor shots with the built-in flash set to auto). Battery usage is above average(with lithium), I found the camera SO easy to use, easy to navigate, shutter was flawless, very quick( using a class 10, 4mg card), and overall was TACK SHARP on the images. Let me repeat, TACK SHARP on the images after reviewing on my Mac. My only major criticism is not to expect much with the zoom fully extended, the images are less than clear, although using a tripod helped this somewhat. I was pretty blown away with the shots, for a $95.00 point and shoot! The super-clear shots were the proof, and build quality was good, LCD screen was fairly good as far as resolution. Overall this is a nice, well-built, great-shooting pocket camera with good features, ease-of-use, and tack-sharp images, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Greatly Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Happy in Tennessee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera (at a store front, not Amazon) after reading all the positive reviews.  I liked the price.  I liked the color.  I liked that it was a Nikon.  However, I didn't like the fact that the camera stopped working after 3 months and 210 pictures.  The screen went black.  The menu still worked. The flash still worked.  But the pictures were completely black.  Just like the screen.  I did further research and found whole blog sites dedicated to this common problem with Nikon Coolpix cameras of all styles; not just with the L22.  There's a matter of "thumping" the camera that may bring it back, but it didn't work for me.  I then read from those who were instructed to send their camera in to Nikon for repair, only to be informed later that this problem wasn't covered under the warranty.  I was told to send it to New York to have it looked at.  No thanks.  Nikon got my first $70, but they won't be getting a penny more from me. I hope this review helps someone else who is considering purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Returned the next day - horrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: Denise's Reviews
Reviews.Content: Bought this on impulse when my beloved Canon G9 died suddenly... thought it would "hold me over" until I was ready to spring for a DSLR.  Massive disappointment, even at an $80 price point.  The photos are blurry and grainy.  The responsiveness of the lens is too slow to be practical.  Essentially useless for any indoor photos.  The people who have given this camera low marks are quite correct.  I returned it after seeing the poor quality of the pictures.  There also appears to be no battery indicator - at least one does not appear on the display.  I'm going to keep using the camera in my cell phone for now.

Reviews.Title: Super Quality Photos!
Reviews.Author: book man
Reviews.Content: This is one great camera. compact, easy to use, and outstanding quality photos. One of the best deals for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for a low price
Reviews.Author: D. Bellouny
Reviews.Content: Purchased this prior to a vacation this summer.  The camera functioned very well.  Daylight photos were almost as good as my digital slr. Low light needed the subjects to be still and a steady hand.  Great value for the money.  The extra optical zoom set this camera ahead of the pack.  Most in the class only have 3x this one has 3.8x. The fact that it takes standard AA batteries was a huge plus when the recharagble batteries ran out.  You will need to buy your own rechargable batteries and charger this unit does not come with them.  Many in this class do.  This is my only knock.

Reviews.Title: Cannot recommend a Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Show-me From MO
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Nikon Coolpix L22 - Red in May, 2010.  We really liked this camera's features and felt that it was doing a good job meeting our needs for a point and shoot camera.  However, within 4 months the latch on the battery/memory card door broke.  It just broke.  The camera was not dropped or abused in any way.  We always handled it with care.  When not in use or traveling with the camera, we kept it in a padded camera bag.We followed the instructions to the letter for returning the camera to Nikon for repair or replacement under the warranty.  Nikon refused to take care of us, their customer, under the warranty.  They claimed that the damage was due to "an impact", despite our statements of the fact that it hadn't been dropped.  They more or less told us that we were lying.  They would repair the camera for $103, which is more than a new one costs.  I had them send our broken camera back to us.  We are trying to use the camera by taping the battery door shut.  We are telling everyone we know not to buy a Nikon. The battery/memory card door latching mechanism is weak and the Nikon customer service is poor.  Wish we had bought a Canon, like our other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Mysti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in August b/c I wanted something small and compact.  I learned a valuable lesson: "You get what you pay for."  It is now broken: the batteries fall out of the case.  Nikon would not cover the item damage in their warranty.  I am a true believer that this was a bad design and not my fault.  i never dropped the camera or did anything that should have caused it to break in this manner.  They wanted to charge me $76 to fix it and the camera itself was only $100.  I will never purchase another Nikon again..anything Nikon.  I have a CANON that I love it is just rather big.  It is a rebel and is made to take great photos.  The only issue with the CANON is that it is not compact.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Outdoor Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with the quality and durability of this little camera.  I personally like the fact that it uses standard batteries available at almost any retailer so it's always "ready to go".  Picture quality is comparable to any other compact camera I've used.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: netterae3
Reviews.Content: This product is very easy to use and is exactly what I needed. It takes great pictures and I love all the settings.

Reviews.Title: Is it just me?
Reviews.Author: 1Pilgrim "1Pilgrim"
Reviews.Content: Is it just me, or is this camera hard to focus? I've taken lots of blurred pics. Hope I get better with it. Haven't had this trouble with other digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Charles K. Stroud
Reviews.Content: Great buy, I shopped around comparing the price for this camera and got the best price here. The iteam area fast and as described. Beautiful camera and simple to use, have only taken a few pictures this far, but excellent.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: D. Turner "Big Dog 1"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera, especially at this price. The 12 megapixel resolution is fantastic. The zoom is great, although not as dramatic as some of the more recent cameras.  The description of the functions in the various modes was great. I am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Flawed, Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Shuttlcapt
Reviews.Content: I got this camera 3 months ago. Soon, the battery door broke such that it would not stay closed. The plastic lock mechanism just broke off. I sent it back to Nikon to the tune of $10 postage only to be told it would cost me $119 to fix. They would not honor the 1 year warranty because it was possible I dropped it or misused it. I have seen other reviews on this unit complaining about the door and got it anyway. So for about 5 months, I got a nice disposable Nikon piece of **** that costs more to fix than buy. No more Nikon for me! You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: janet hill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband for fathers day. It did not come with a manual, only a disc of info. I called the company to request a printed copy and was told "instructions are not important" and that they do not have a printed manual. The second time my husband turned camera on, it seized up and would not do anything. After multiple  e-mails and phone calls, Nikon agreed to look at camera if I would pay for shipping to them. After having the camera for 7 plus weeks they agreed to replace it. The replacement camera stopped working yesterday. I don't beleive I will pay another $25.00 in shipping to argue with Nikon again. I am very disappointed in the camera quality as well as the customer service at Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I have ever had.
Reviews.Author: Marni
Reviews.Content: This takes good close ups of objects (hit the little flower on scroll circle) and I used it to send knob pictures as an email attachment to the retailer I bought a stove from which arrived with two broken handles.  Other reviewers that haven't liked the indoor pictures probably just selected wrong setting.  I haven outdoor pictures and indoor pictures of my home for listing on the internet, and all the pictures are very good. This camera is an excellent choice for a realtor.  I think the camera is very pretty with the chrome against the matte black.  Large screen. The price on AMAZON was best, and free shipping was lightening fast.Well after fourteen months, the battery door is broken.  So, I rated it 2 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pics ..takes forever
Reviews.Author: NJGuy
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this camera....Pics are blurry and I can take a nap before I can snap a pictureI am surprised this got good reviews

Reviews.Title: Shouldn't modern technology be better than it was 2 years ago?
Reviews.Author: Armando N. Roman
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung L100 that was probably the best camera I'd owned until it broke earlier this year. It seemed like the camera couldn't do anything wrong when it came to taking pictures, though the video recording left a bit to be desired. When it broke, I first tried my luck with the Fujifilm FinePix JZ300...and it was the first camera I ever rated 1 star (and I don't just give that rating out). So my next attempt was this Nikon Coolpix L22 here. I'd owned a Coolpix a few years earlier, and it took decent pictures. Oddly enough, this one takes slightly worse pictures, and there's a trick to getting non-blurry ones. That shouldn't be the case with what's considered a simple point and click camera. Keep in mind that I'm no professional photographer, nor am I one of those people who calls themselves one just because they take a lot of pictures and thinks the title fits. It's just a hobby, plain and simple. But I do know clarity and detail when I see it, and when it's missing.First things first, yes, most of the time your pictures will be blurry when using this camera on the Auto setting. You can set the camera down on a table or something with the self-timer on, and take a picture of something that's immobile, and chances are that it'll be blurry in the picture. Why? I don't know. But get this- there's a trick to getting an ok picture on Auto: zooming in just a little bit. I know, it sounds stupid, but the only time I'm ever able to get good pictures if when I turn the Macro setting on, and when I zoom in a tiny bit. If I zoom a little more or not at all, the picture is a mess, and not worth keeping. Some of the special settings like Sunset and all that can make for good pictures and set the mood beautifully, but after trying out all of them several times over the last 4 months, only 5 have been helpful.Other poor features worth mentioning include the random times it takes to process a picture. Sometimes you'll take a picture, and it'll be done immediately, ready for another. But then there'll be times when you'll wait between 5 and 20 seconds (yes, TWENTY seconds) before you can take another. And the times really are random too, they don't depend on how complicated the image was. Taking a picture of a full moon: just the black night sky and the white moon took 11 seconds once, while a ton of gorgeous fireworks that filled took a quick 2 seconds. Another time, the same full moon picture was 1 second deal. Crazy, but true. Something positive I can say for it though is that the battery life is very good. I've never even seen the Low Battery warning pop up, even on the 4th of July when over 300 pictures and a dozen or so 5+ minute videos were recorded.When it comes down to it, this camera isn't worth the full price I paid for it. At the current price it's going for, you could certainly do worse (Fujifilm, I'm lookin' at you), but if you can try out cameras in the store or have friends with cameras that you can test out, do that before blindly ordering this. Maybe I'll try hunting down another Samsung L100...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James Talley
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews, those good and bad, I decided to purchase this camera, and actually received it earlier than Amazon had stated.  With that said, this is a simple point and shoot camera.  I think the bad reviews (however, I'm concerned about the 'flimsy' battery door cover) were based on some folks not knowing how to 'use' the camera.  Basic camera operation, press the shutter HALFWAY, it beeps when it's focused, and then continue pressing the button all the way down.  Picture was taken immediately, no wait time like some of the reviews implied here, and the results were excellent.  Picture was in focus, colors were good, and overall for the price of the camera, it did a darn good job!  I took photos outdoors and indoors in various lightning conditions with overall excellent results.  I even used the macro mode for very up close shots.  I did find that turning the flash mode to the 'off' setting, prevented the picture from being washed out, and with the flash off the results were pretty good using ambient light for macro shots. With more use of the camera, I'll find out how great the battery life is, movie mode and some of the other advanced features. So, even though I've only used it for a day, I'm very satisfied with this camera and would suggest it to friends who are looking for a good camera with a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Glenn C. Martinet
Reviews.Content: I gave up having my Panasonic Lumix repaired 5+yrs old. Lens cover was a constant issue. So I did my research and liked the Nikon Coolpix L22.1. Has a bunch of features but is really easy to use in auto mode2. Great Photos, scenery, sunsets, etc.3. Great people photos and great features for taking people pictures.4. light as a feather.5 Well built not junk, amazing forthis price.6 uses 2 "AA" batteries rechargable or Alk. this is really a great convienance.7 Movies were really clear and you can zoom while taking them.8 The LCD display is large and works great in bright light (unlike my previous camera)I highly reccommend this camera another really good Nikon Product.Nikon Coolpix L22 12 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Easy to Use, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Otis G.
Reviews.Content: It has been quite a while since I purchased my first digital camera and I was a bit concerned I may end up with a bum product. I performed a few weeks of research getting up to date on the brands, models, and technology. After seeing so many positive reviews, other websites too, I decided to purchase. This camera met my requirements and the price was excellent.Since purchasing this camera I know it was the right choice for me. Pictures are excellent, though not front page national geographic type quality, its what you expect for the price. I would use this camera on vacation trips and important events. Its features were easy to figure out w/o having to dig through the manual. I enjoy the different types of shooting styles and ease of switching between them.Overall, I would say if you need a great camera for shooting photos of your kids on the beach, wanna update the FB album, or just to catch a few snapshots on a trip this is an ideal camera and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Nice pocket point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: K. Dommer
Reviews.Content: I've always felt that you get better pictures out of a "normal size camera" as opposed to these tiny ones that fit in your pocket.  While I still feel that way, I must say that so far I am pleased with this Coolpix L22.  I still love my bulkier Sony camera, but let's face it... sometimes you wish you had a small camera that would just slip in your pocket.  I was hesitant to choose one, but after spending some time reading reviews here, I decided to give it a try.There are mixed reviews here but overall I find that it takes pretty nice pictures.  I've always had better luck with digital cameras if you give it some time to focus by holding the shutter half-down before taking the shot.  Sure you can just slam the shutter button down to take a pic, but it seems to me that this method tends to rush the focus, sometimes resulting in a bad pic that otherwise might have been okay.So does this camera ever take bad pics?  Sure it does, and so does my Sony that cost several hundred dollars more.  If you are using automatic settings and you are not a professional photographer, you will always take an occasionally bad picture.  And virtually all cameras have difficulty with focus and grain in low light (unless you use manual settings and know what you are doing.... and have a tripod that would allow you to use proper low light settings without creating a huge blur).  Overall though for what it is and the convenience it offers, I am quite pleased with it (and I can be picky sometimes).  I have taken some of my best pictures with my Sony and also some of my worst.  This camera is no exception.I've also seen some reviewers complain about the fact that it uses AA batteries.  Normally I agree with that too.... I'd rather use a rechargeable battery pack.  Keep a spare always charged and you are good to go.  They usually last much longer than a couple AA batteries too.  HOWEVER, one of the reasons I chose this camera is *because* it uses AA batteries.  We tend to use this camera when we are in the middle of nowhere (i.e. in the forest) and it's nice to know that all you need with you is a pack of batteries that you can buy virtually anywhere.  Our flashlight, GPS and camera all use the same AA batteries which is very convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L22 Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Bear 57
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this Nikon as a pocket camera, and it's GREAT for that purpose. I don't expect it to replace my Nikon D90 or My D3100, so I can accept it's limitations, but this is an amazing pocket camera that will take perfect pictures straight out of the box in minutes, if used correctly-(which is super easy). This camera cannot be beat for the money-the technology is awesome and the Nikon quality is there. So if you're looking for a great SMALL pocket camera that will take perfect pictures, the L22 is a great choice.The price is fantastic, so I purchased the oops protection plan in case I fumbled and dropped it-(it's pretty tiny for large hands). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: BRB
Reviews.Content: A great, reasonably priced camera that is intuitive to operate and produces high-quality images. Bought this for my mom as a birthday present, and she hasn't been able to put it down. :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: kbw63
Reviews.Content: Amazing value for this camera! Loaded with features and easy to use. The image quality is excellent. This camera comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Very disappoint with Nikon product.
Reviews.Author: Captain Planet
Reviews.Content: I have used Nikon for more than 20 years, from N65, D50 to D90, plus all the lens.  I purchased the L22 just for business travel and easy to carry.  It last for 6 months and the battery latch door broke.  I called and sent to Nikon repair center, oveall experience with the center was poor to ok, not very friendly probably it is in LA.The cost for the repairment (due to not cover by the warranty?  why?  only 6 months....they said due to user fault)?? was $68.50.  Must be kidding, I am very disappointed by Nikon and its service...It takes years to build the reputation, but takes days to destroy.......

Reviews.Title: Would return it if I could
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera that was a s easy to use as my old Canon.  I read up on this camera and felt it was a user friendly, good quality camera.  I'm finding that its very slow to make it available to snap another picture and a lot of time, the pictures have come out very fuzzy. I would not recommend this camera.  Even though I can't return it, I think I will buy another camera.  Always remember, you get what you pay for.  If its cheap in price, its probably cheap in quality

Reviews.Title: Battery latch is poorly made
Reviews.Author: Martini Lover
Reviews.Content: Over-all the camera would be good, but the battery latch is poorly designed. It breaks extremely easily and Nikon customer support is worthless. I would recommend finding a better designed camera.

Reviews.Title: No refund even with a proctection plan!
Reviews.Author: aleanbean
Reviews.Content: I have never been more dissapointed in a camera in my whole life.  I would rather have manula film loading camera than this.  I have to keep a rubberband around the battery door to keep it shut.  The warranty is a joke.  They want ME to pay for shipping to them while they will tell me it's not a manufacturers error in production.  They don't stand behind their products.  Cannon here I come!  Do not buy!  WARNING!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for college student
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures for the normal, everyday person! I go hiking, to sporting events, out at night, beach, and everywhere in between. It is perfect for all!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Doctor Goose "Sierra Goose"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to augment an Olympus and Fuji that I already have and it is everything I wanted it to be. In my opinion the Nikon software is kind of Cheezy, but then so is the Olympus software, so......Takes great pictures.My only negative would be that it seems to burn through batteries rather quickly, but that would be a minor issue for me.I'd certainly get another and give as gift to anyone wanting a digital camera!!!(I still like film, but it's getting fairly scarce and expensive when you do find it)....

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is more than COOL!
Reviews.Author: B. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I AM SO PLEASED WITH THIS CAMERA. i BOUGHT IT FOR AN ORGANIZATION I BELONG TO AND WAS PLEASED WITH THE AMOUNT, THE COLOR AND THE QUALITY OF THE PICTURES I HAVE TAKEN. I ALSO LIKE THE EASE IN WHICH I CAN TRANSFER THEM TO MY COMPUTER.BEING ABLE TO VIEW THE PICS IMMEDIATEDLY IS A GREAT HELP FOR A DUFFER LIKE ME.

Reviews.Title: Good Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Rogers
Reviews.Content: While it doesn't have some features of the newer models like a touch screen, this model is pretty simple to use and produces quality pictures.  It's also small enough to carry around comfortably in a jacket pocket and turns on quickly and is ready to go which is nice for taking quick snapshots on trips. All in all a pretty good value if you are looking for a decent easy to use camera for around a hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: B. S. Schlafke
Reviews.Content: I received my Nikon L22 in less time than I was expecting it.  As I was going on a trip, this was very pleasing to me.  My camera arrived in perfect shape and I'm most happy with my purchase.  The price and quality was everything I expected and more.  I have shown my camera to many family members and they are very surprised and amazed at the photo quality and clarity, the looks of this very sleek,compact camera, and that I got it all for an amazing low price!  Yes, I will do more business with Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Much better than expected
Reviews.Author: P. Probst
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 7 YO this past Christmas to replace a sub-$100 Nikon P&S; that failed after 2 years.  I was at first concerned with Nikon's poor reputation for P&S; cameras, it has a plastic body, and the need to go into the electronic menu to change basic settings rather than turn a physical dial.  However, this did not at all trouble my daughter and she quickly figured it all out.  NOTE: I'm just in awe of how easily even the youngest kids seem to be able to quickly master complex mobile phones and digital electronics.  It has a decent size viewfinder that's been easy to see in bright outdoor light. The camera has consistently produced satisfying snap shots and 5x7 enlargements (good color and sharpness) and is really easy to use. Battery life is OK and it uses regular batteries so replacements are never an issue.  She loves this camera and I kind of like it too ... when I get the chance to use it.In our experience, it's been a reliable entry level camera.

Reviews.Title: Biggest Piece of Crap Camera I Ever Owned - Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: I love Amazon "Cash"
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I ever bought.  I bought it our trip.  And half of the pictures turned out terrible.  And its not me.  I have owned many cameras.  I only bought this as I read it was a good camera and it was cheap and small.  I didn't want to bring my big expensive canon on trip.  And NO I did not expect canon slr quality out of this camera.  But this Nikon Coolpix L22 is such a piece of trash in my opinion that it doesn't flash when it should and does in bright sunlight.  It never worked in dark light settings (the flash never worked).  And the automatic settings never adjusted correctly to the environment.  The auto rotate only worked occasionally when I tuend to camera sideways to take a picture.  Most pictures were not focused.  The face detection never worked right - and not once recognized more than one face in the shot.  This is absolutely the worse camera I have ever used.  Its not worth 5 bucks.  And I can not return it as my kids threw out the box before we left on trip.  Ugggh.

Reviews.Title: WHAT'S WITH IT, SONY? Your COOL-PIX L22 : A BIG NEGATIVE
Reviews.Author: yzzpl
Reviews.Content: I purchased the NIKON: COOK PIX: L22 at Office Depot for $119.00 AND I'm glad I purchased the OFFICE DEPOT 2 year warranty because about 1 year later the 'camera's computer' MALFUNCTIONED saying "BATTERY DEPLETED'.  Nope my batteries were new and fresh. So I returned it, and purchased the SAME MODEL L22 which by now was on sale for $79.00. WITHIN 1 month the same problem occurred:  'BATTER DEPLETED'.  I could not find my receipt.  It's strange that even though I'd lost my receipt TWICE and never could 'INITIATE the RETURN POLICY, after 11 months I finally spoke with OFFICE DEPOT, they FOUND MY RECEIPT,and I called an OFFICE DEPOT manager who politely said 'BRING IT BACK'.  My DILEMMA is after reading all these WONDERFUL 'CRITICAL' reviews, I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO BUY or how much to spend. I never had much use for ALL THE CAMERA FEATURES anyway, and in the past I've owned SLR 35mm CAMERAS, and never went  with DIGITAL HIGH-END cameras. I wanted SIMPLICITY. SO WHAT'S HAPPENED to SONY and Nikon?  DOES ANYBODY MAKE A GOOD 'point-n-shoot' camera under $200.00 anymore? ANYWAY, THESE 'CRITICAL REVIEWS' are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: 5 STARS - MAYBE?
Reviews.Author: Piano Teacher "Music Rules"
Reviews.Content: I chose to put this under 5 stars because I am basically an optimist who only reads the 5 star ratings.  I kind of think that most 1 star people are negative and will find fault with any product.  Boy was I duped.  Yep, the camera seemed like a great little camera for about 9 months.  If I had given it a review right after purchase, it might have been 5 stars.  Then the battery compartment latch (made of cheap plastic) failed.  I went through all the hassle of shipping it back to Nikon at my own expense for what I thought would be a warrantied repair only to have them refuse to cover it under warranty, claiming that the camera was dropped or abused.  Luckily I had a Square Trade Warranty.  My extended warranty was honored with great customer service and little to no hassles, plus I received 5% more than my purchase price when the claim was settled.  So, back to Amazon I went to find another camera.  THEN I started reading the 1 star reviews for my L22 and L24.  And wala .... it seems this is an issue on all Nikon Coolpix cameras.  Cheap little plastic latch breaks and Nikon wants over $100 to repair the camera.  So buyer beware - take this into consideration before making your purchase.  Take the time to read some of those 1-2-3 star reviews to see just what problems may arise.  And - do yourself a favor and spend the extra $15 to get the extended warranty.  You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: alisse22
Reviews.Content: We originally purchased the Nikon Coolpix L22 for our son's birthday present.  I purchased it over the Thanksgiving day weekend, even though his birthday isn't until February.  Amazon did a great job.  The camera arrived in just a couple days.  Love that super saver shipping.  I just packed the box up into our closet to wait until the birthday party.Fast Forward 3 months.  We're in the middle of a 12 year old's birthday party...  and he wants to try out his new camera.  We took it out of the box and...  the battery latch is defective and completely broken off..  It won't hold the batteries in no matter what we try.  I then called support, explained my issue and pay to send it to them.  About 2 weeks later I get an invoice in the mail telling me if I want my camera fixed I have to pay 70$  That was almost what we paid for the camera NEW!I had them send the camera back to us.  I was very disappointed.  After doing many more web searches I have found that this issue is very common in the "Coolpix" line of cameras.(In fact google "battery door latch" and the first result is about a Nikon Coolpix...  many of the following results are as well)Now on to the technical side.  Once I got the camera back I used some electrical tape and taped the battery latch door shut so that I could do some side by side comparison's.Compared to my Panasonic Lumix DMC-FS3 8.1 Megapixel it fell short in every test I made with it.  Low light shots where blurry, there was a significant amount of noise in the images, and the colors appeared dull in comparison.  The video was dull and quite grainy.  The sound quality on the video was low and tinny.  The only bright spot on the camera was the menu's were easy to navigate and simple to operate.  On the Nikon the on/off was a push button and took over 2 seconds to power up, and to actually focus and take a "good" picture in "easy mode" it was more like 5 - 7 seconds.(fastest = 5, slowest = 10)  The Panasonic on the other hand has an on/off slider and was taking 3 - 4 seconds for a power-up shot.  In the size department the L22 is pretty large for a "point and shoot" it was much larger than the Panasonic.  For Menu's between the two.  I liked the layout of the Nikon.  At first glance it was easy to setup "favorite modes" so you could easily switch your camera between Auto, Easy Auto, Video, and 1 preset mode.  But in function it was very slow.  You'd push the button and nothing would happen.  Press it a second time and watch the menu's flash up, then down again.  It just wasn't very fast.  The Panasonic took a bit more work getting the presets enabled, but it was very quick.Over all, based on it's performance I'd give it a rating of 2.  Based on the poorly designed battery latch, and the poor reception we received from Nikon support...  I will be giving this product a 0.  And I doubt I will be purchasing another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied at all!
Reviews.Author: danielleh
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my mom for Christmas last year. Already having problems with it! It drains the batteries, even when they are taken out and put in the camera right before getting ready to use it, she is only able to take about 20 pictures and then it says the batteries are exhausted. Also have problems with the pictures it takes. They turn out yellow and blurry. The camera is only able to be returned through Amazon for 30 days, so now we either have to contact the manufacturer or be out $90. Not my idea of a good purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great As A Back-up, Very Good Quality
Reviews.Author: Scott D. Welch
Reviews.Content: I use my Nikon Coolpix L22 primarily as a back-up when I don't have my D60 with me. It is always hanging on my belt, ready to go. I find that the quality of the images are, most generally, excellent. It does have VR but I find that for extremes in zoom mode it is limited unless I have a mono or tripod. But for times I visit a museum where they do not allow large cameras (or, as one exhibit told me, anything with a detachable lens) this L22 works quite well, capturing images in all sorts of different lighting. The available settings (flash, no flash, sports, portrait, etc) are a nice feature for an inexpensive quality unit. There is even a "museum" setting. The 12mp image size is great. I typically use AA batteries (Duracell or Energizer) and they last for an extremely long time, probably a good 200-300 shots, maybe more. It is very easy to get used to and operate, with a nice size preview screen. Overall I am very pleased with the Coolpix L22 and would recommend it for amateurs, enthusiasts, or anyone needing to have a back-up for, as I said, times when larger gear is not allowed.

Reviews.Title: Nice, Neat, Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I am no digital camera expert and have owned only two digital cameras in my entire life, , but I do try to do my research on anything that I purchase and after reading more reviews than I care to think about I decided to buy the Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red-primary) as a Christmas gift for my wife.  I will keep the other digital camera a 6 MP Sony Cybershot that has served us well as a back-up.The Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera is very simple to use, but if you want to make any changes to settings then you will have to go into the settings menu rather than using a dial setting like on many cameras, but I have found that in most cases I use the same settings time and again.  But with practice you can get used to the new way of doing things.The camera arrived on time just before Christmas so I gave it to my wife a little early so she could start getting used to it before the family got together for the holiday.  When we got over to my son's house my wife quickly pulled out her new camera from her purse to take a picture of the grand baby and she fumbled it and it flew out of her hands and onto the hard tile floor, pieces flying every where.  I couldn't help myself and said something to the affect "Oh well that didn't last long".  As we started gathering up the what I thought initially were pieces of the camera I realized that it was the two AA batteries that had flown across the floor when the battery compartment opened on impact.  I put the batteries back in the camera and tentatively hit the power button and to my delight it came on and went on to take the sharpest pictures I have ever seen.  There was not so much as a scratch on the camera.  I certainly wouldn't recommend trying such a brutal test, but I would say that it is an indication of the quality and reliability of the camera.  It made me think of the old Timex commercials - "It takes a licking and keeps on ticking!".A serious or professional photographer would not want this camera because it does not give them the quick control they want and need over the shots.  If you are a serious or professional photographer than you probably are not reading this review and if you are there is no point in tearing it apart because it doesn't stand up to cameras costing many times more than this one.  After reading some of the negative reviews I feel that the writers are in a different category of camera user than most of us.I paid $80 at Christmas time 2010 and now I see the price has dropped down to less than $76.  At that price I am not going to complain unless the camera doesn't take a fairly decent picture.  This camera takes such clear shots that it can be a little unnerving.  I personally will not take a close-up shot of myself with this camera because you can see every little skin blemish and wrinkle.  These days I prefer blurry photos of myself. ;-)The only reason I gave it less than a perfect 5x5 rating is because I have not used the video much and that I haven't used the camera enough to make that kind of judgement and I have not had any contact with Amazon's Customer Service department and with all the things that I buy from Amazon I suppose that should tell you something.  I will follow-up with another review if there is something worth reporting on.If you want a camera that will take very crisp, sharp, great pictures and is small enough to carry in your shirt pocket or handbag and is an absolute screaming bargain on price then I think that you'll be very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Its OK for the money
Reviews.Author: LightningGal
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before Christmas because I dropped my HP camera and broke it. I wanted a basic camera under $100 but one that still rated really well with Consumer Reports. This one was rated OK with CR (it liked the S3000 better but more $$). Since my HP camera was like $59 I figured this would be fine.When I first got it and took some test shots. It took nice pictures (I was in a well lit room). But I went to a party a week later and was trying to get some pictures of my friend dancing (a truly rare occasion that HAD to  be captured on film). The camera refused to take a good picture. They came out dark, blurry - just awful. On my HP I could force the flash. If this camera has that option, Nikon has done a phenomenal job hiding it. HP just put a flash button so it was very easy to figure out. Often when I go to take the picture and click to take it, nothing happens. I hold the button down and nothing. I release and click again, THEN it decides to take the picture. Meanwhile, my audience is trying to be patient and hold the pose. Annoying.The video is also just OK. It is definitely better in well lit situations.So I rate the camera as "OK" because it does take good pictures in good lighting. I read somewhere that someone was having trouble getting Kingston brand memory cards to work but mine (4gb) works just fine.I'll keep the camera rather than deal with the hassle of returning it but if I had it to do over again, I probably wouldn't buy it.

Reviews.Title: A Bit Disappointed
Reviews.Author: God's Girl
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Coolpix in order to have a good digital camera for my parents' 50th anniversary celebration.  When we used it, many of the pictures looked fine on the camera's viewing screen, but were fuzzy and blurred when viewed later on the computer screen.  I understand that resolution will be better the smaller the image is, but the pictures were not lacking in resolution- they were just plain blurred- like the photographer moved.  This should have shown up better on the camera's screen so the photographer would know to take another shot.  In addition, I was under the impression that the camera had a stabilization feature that would reduce the liklihood of blurred shots due to camera movement, but perhaps I misunderstood that feature.  A number of the pictures had questionable color quality.  Reds looked like hot pink, and it was not possible to properly correct the red color without affecting other aspects of the photos, such as skin tones.In order to be fair, it is not the top of the line model, and maybe my expectations were too high for the model I purchased.  It is possible that some of the problem lies with the operator and not the camera.  I hope that photo quality improves as I gain more experience with it.  I am not giving up on it yet!On the positive side, it is a nice, compact, lightweight camera, yet it appears to be well-made and durable.  The controls are simple to understand and easy to use.  The screen is a nice size.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Alyssa Ray-Alden
Reviews.Content: I got this camera back in August right before I was going to see concert. I was looking for something cheap, reliable, and that actually worked. This camera does all of that! I posted some pics I took at the concert that night at the Paramore concert and I got some GREAT pictures!This isn't really a camera for people who are looking for a long term family or art camera. Its more for people like me who are more looking for something good that wont cost them a bundle because they use it in high breakage risk scenarios. I'm 19. I go through electronics like that! In fact I had bought this camera once and within 3 hours my nephew dropped it and it broke so I bought it again. I get everything as high tech as possible and have had an ipod since I was 13. That being said,  I love this camera! I do eventually want to get an SLR but for now this camera takes an amazing picture and the price is right. For concerts, going out with friends, or family gatherings - you wont be disappointed with the pictures you get.Pros: Simple to use, big viewing screen, records video with good sound, takes AMAZING picturesCons: Takes a moment between pictures. After you take a picture you have to wait a moment before you can take another.Overall: I would in a heart beat buy this camera a third time!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: wallydog
Reviews.Content: I have had other digital cameras this seems to be the best so far. It focus' very fast and after a picture is taken its ready for the next one almost instantly. The modes are very useful as well. I am very pleased with this so far.

Reviews.Title: It was used at a recent wedding with great results
Reviews.Author: John Garland
Reviews.Content: I needed aa easy to use camera and have owned Nikons in the past.I found this camera had all the features I desired except for one and it is the lack of a printed users handbbook. Going to the internet or a CD to find a solution was quite unhandy.Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Manuel
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived on time and well packaged. Everything that should have been included was. Needed a pocket camera for a trip I was taking and though I didn't know much about it, my old camera died so I took a chance on this one. It seems pretty well made, and judging from the abuse it got on it's maiden voyage, it should hold up well. It was the only camera I took, so I was asking a lot from it. I took nearly 500 pictures and a few videos on the original alkaline batteries that came with it. I find that unbelievable. There were a small percentage that were out of focus, but in general the performance was very acceptable. The camera is pretty easy to use and takes good pictures. I rarely print over 4" x 6", so my prints (and screen appearance) have nice color and sharpness. I was using a mid-range setting (5M) so it's capable of even better images. The flash tended to be tricky, but when it worked (most likely operator error) it was strong enough to produce good pictures. I'm not sure I would have been as happy had I paid $300 for it, but at $100 I find it a very good deal. Love the AA batteries, a deal maker/breaker for me. There were times I had the only working camera in the group. The only issue I currently have with it is the battery/memory card compartment. I don't like it when both are housed behind the same cover. The construction of this one makes me approach it very carefully, and the card is hard to remove.

Reviews.Title: Captured Some of the Most Important Moments
Reviews.Author: MickiSue
Reviews.Content: My older camera, an Olympus from 2003, had suffered the Lens Failure death so common to digital point and shoots, and I needed a new camera for a BIG reason: our son was getting married. It had to be a decent price, because weddings have enough expenses without new cameras, and it had to work well in light and dark, because they were getting married in the early evening.So, after an exhaustive review of the middle of the road point and shoots, I settled on the Nikon L22. And was very pleased with the results. Once my husband and I figured out the fairly easy to learn menu of options, we were consistently taking good photos, close up and at a distance. The pictures of the wedding were great! But we've also used it for some lovely pictures in the garden, and some sightseeing pictures, as well.If you want a camera that will do ALL the thinking for you, this isn't your camera; you do need to make some choices under varying conditions. On the other hand, if you want a camera that takes both great still photos and video, this isn't your camera, either; the video is passable, but not great. But if you want a camera that will take crisp, great pictures, and is small enough to carry in an evening bag (!) this IS your camera.

Reviews.Title: Good snapshot camera, sometimes slow
Reviews.Author: Joao Coelho "Factor Jota"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera to have as a point-and-shoot. The AA bateries instead of charger can have its pros and cons..  the major advantages (to me) are:1. No need for a charger. One less thing to worry about and keep track of.2. If the battery goes empty in the middle of the day, AA batteries are available everywhere (or you can take a spare couple).If you want to save on batteries, you can always get rechargeable ones.The main dislike about this camera is that sometimes it takes a (really) long time to take the shot. Not sure why as I also have one other similar model (Nikon Coolpix S220) and it doesn't take half as long. This causes quite a bit of frustration and in my opinion, Nikon gets its brand detiriorated more than it saves money.Still, a nice camera, especially for people who don't know much about which settings to use and just want to use the one button to take shots.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  It is a good camera at a great price.  I'm not looking for something fancy but I'm going on a trip soon so I want something that will take decent pictures.  This is it.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I actually was out in stores looking for a camera. My daughter suggested this one, and what a purchase it has been. My oldest daughter and I love taking pictures, and although I am not a professional photographer by any means, and this is not a "professional camera" the pictures this camera takes are amazing. We have had more comments on the site where our pictures are then we did without this camera.It's easy to use, I am in no means a "techie" and have learned to use this camera with ease. The automatic focus is wonderful. The fact that it uses AA batteries is a plus.

Reviews.Title: the best easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: famousstar2005
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use camera. You can just point and shoot and your pictures come out looking amazing. I absolutely love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures from a basic camera
Reviews.Author: VArose "V Rose"
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement camera, but didn't have a lot to spend, so this Nikon was my choice. I have had it for a month, and I have been very happy with the image quality, from inside to outdoors, and especially close-ups. The camera does not have a lot of complicated features, but the settings work well. I don't use the easy auto setting very much, because it doesn't usually pick the appropriate setting. But I have had good results with the automatic setting, and choosing my own scene mode like macro or sports. I often turn off the flash for better results, and the pictures do not get blurry like on my old camera. The zoom works very well, even after you go past the optical zoom and into digital. The only slight issue I have found is that it is sometimes slow to take the shot and save it so that you can take the next one. This seems to be a Coolpix thing, because my last one did it too. However, my final comment would be on how great the video quality is. I was impressed with both the sound and image quality of the few I've taken so far. If you are looking for an affordable basic digital camera, then I highly suggest the Coolpix L22.

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera, great features, amazing photos!
Reviews.Author: D. Beckett
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for everyday use, vacation shots, sports photos, and more. We take low-light, no flash photos with this on the "sports" setting for dance recitals and plays. The photos turn out terrific, and people always ask what camera we use because they are so impressed with the clarity of the shots.This camera has numerous features and settings. The navigation between settings is pretty intuitive, and the instruction manual has lots more ideas too. It has good video capability for capturing something in a video file when you don't have a camcorder handy. You don't need special software to upload photos from this camera - I have a card reader in my computer to do all that.The camera does a good job conserving battery life. We use rechargeable AA batteries without any problems for hundreds of photos per charge. It's compact and fairly lightweight, and it fits into a shirt pocket with ease.The large screen makes reviewing photos easy, and deleting ones from the camera is simple with just a touch of a button plus an "are you sure?" question to keep you from potentially erasing something in error.The 3.6x optical zoom is an improvement over the previous Nikon Coolpix we had, so this is now the favorite camera in my home! If you've had a Coolpix in the past and are thinking about getting a newer version, definitely do it! You'll find the operations and menu choices very similar to what you're used to, but with added improvements that you'll appreciate.We've not had any problems with the battery cover on this camera or the previous Coolpix cameras we still own. If you break the battery cover, it's time for a new camera, unfortunately. But it's very sturdy and reliable, so we've never worried about it much.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: S. Kang
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's so simple to work. I used to own an older model of Canon and it stopped working within 4 years. Afterward, I start to look for a simple functioning camera. This is it! Everything is pretty much self explanatory. However, if you can't figure out certain functions then you can always turn to the manual. Also the pictures I took on my old camera looks much clearer with this Nikon camera.I recommend this camera for people who are looking for something simple and easy to use. I don't think it has any special features for advanced photographers who want to do creative things on the camera. But I personally love this camera.
