Also I would recommend the generic camera bag from Amazon as well. It's so cheap and fits the camera perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Photo Pal
Reviews.Author: Ivison D. Rowland
Reviews.Content: Purchased for teenage Grandaughter's birthday. I have purchased similar cameras for other of my grandchildren, and have found that even 'entry-level-plus' grade cameras from Nikon are a cut above the competition. I believe that photography is an acquired skill, and getting good quality photographs during the learning process avoids the discouragement that often accompanies cheap camera results.. Nikon doesn't install sub-par lenses. The versatility of digital cameras has enabled new snapshot artists to grow into accomplished photographers much sooner than in the film photo era.. PLUS it is a pretty camera that a teenager can be proud of using..

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE LITTLE KIDS!!
Reviews.Author: T. L. Lucas "emalucas"
Reviews.Content: this camera is the biggest POS EVER! I should have returned it right after I bought it, I could tell it would not suit my needs right away. I expected to at least be able to take good pics of our young daughter and I have missed so many great pic opportunities as a result of this camera. 3 reasons why NOT to buy this camera IF you have little kids (If taking pics of adults/ people who can stay still, or still photos, it is just fine).1. There are too many "auto" sensors which makes taking pics slower. The auto smile feature takes a few mins to focus which is horrible when taking pics of little kids. without the smile sensor it is ok but you have to turn it off each time you use the camera.2. Flash. The auto flash is sometimes too bright indoors and then sometimes doesn't auto come on like it should making pics blurry3. in June 2012 (I bought it in April 2011) the door for the battery compartment started popping open on it's own whenever taking pics. The camera was not dropped, not damaged in any way, I have no idea why one day this started happening. once batts are back in you have to reset time & date. I tried pressing down on the springs inside because without batts in the door would close just fine. But that didn't work. then I put duct tape over the door (ghetto!) and the batts would even fall out then!

Reviews.Title: Incredible option- Auto Mode+White Balance
Reviews.Author: Ceta
Reviews.Content: Hi allI have the cam for around two years now.As a point and shot cam i just use the preset templates for night or portrait or landscape....etcalso as we all know the worst things in the point and shot cams are the flash & night photos.guess what this not a problem at all with this cam as it contains and incredible option to use ,its AUTOMODE + WByou can access this mode by1- Clicking on the mode button (Green Cam Logo)2- Select the last mode (Auto Mode)3- Click on the MENU Button4- Select WB  (White balance)5- Select Manual preset6- direct the cam to the center of the location you want to shot.7- select MEASURE. and click OK.8- Cam Automatically Calculates the White balance. (Even at night)9- Enjoy good photos with no flash and even at night.

Reviews.Title: Warranty a Joke
Reviews.Author: Kevin Burke
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my mother-in-law. She treats the camera like it is Gold and even uses a camera case etc. The battery door latch will not stay shut. She returned it under warranty and they will not repair. They claim "impact damage" and want $75 to repair a $100 camera and $13 to return it either way. Next time (which looks like soon since the camera is not useable) I will buy a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Plastic Battery Latch Broke
Reviews.Author: kim y seng
Reviews.Content: What good is a product if it breaks within a year? After less than a year of use... nothing major, the battery latch broke. The latch is made out of the same plastic the body is constructed with. I believe it was part of the same mold. Whatever the design, it broke, rendering the camera useless. I'm not sure why Nikon would design a battery latch made of cheap plastic. This is the one most important function in any electronic product. It opens and closes constantly and it's the power source to the device. Why would it be made of plastic!?!

Reviews.Title: Poor design on battery door
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for a few months and had been generally happy - picture quality was good and it was easy to use.  Just recently the battery door started popping open whenever I tried to use the camera.  There is nothing obvious that is broken, but the door simply will not stay latched.  Researching possible solutions on the internet indicates lots of Nikon owners are having problems with the battery door.  I naturally can't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: It just died one day, no explanation!
Reviews.Author: Teresa McKearney
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter as a Christmas gift.  If was working fine and then one day it just died, no explanation no reason.  The longevity of this camera should be more than 6months, she didn't even use it that much.  I would not recommend this product due to the fact it's unpredictable and non-fixable.

Reviews.Title: Great especially if you're new to digital cameras!
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Lomenzo "Doc Tony"
Reviews.Content: Before I begin, note Amazon comment that there is an update of this camera, the Nikon "L-24" while this review deals with the almost identical L-22 model but I note the 'updated' L-24 offers 14.0 megapixels while the L-22 offers 12.0 megapixels. Since my overall savvy of photography AND cameras consists of two words, viz., "point and shoot", I'm hardly the one to comment on megapixels or anything else camera feature wise since the L-22 under review was/is my first 'digital' camera. Here's the story in brief: I kept noticing folks with 'digital' cameras and I commented after watching one long term friend shoot pic after pic in succession, "how many pictures can you take with that thing?" and he responds that with his 'memory' insert, he can take 'hundreds' [!] of pics! Needless to say, I was still using those instant flash cameras with the 26 pics and then you get the film developed routine but I decided to take the plunge into 'digital' cameras especially since our grown children introduced us to Facebook and this business of taking pics and then [if one wanted to] immediately transferring those pics [via the supplied USB cable that comes wsith the digital camera] into the computer picture gallery and then on to Facebook! I was so fascinated by the process and which admittedly has been around for some years but, hey, you know the old story, you tend to keep with the familiar and 'digital' cameras 'do' have the proverbial learning curve until you know what you're doing! Anyway, I went a further step and bought one of those photo digital copiers [the Epson V30 which I got on sale and free shipping at Amazon] and then I could put family pics on Facebook [not to mention digitally "preserving" them from the ravages of time!] and old classic pics and even [with the V30] take some of the time caused smudge marks out of the pics and even enhance the color of older color photos!Anyway, this is an excellent starter 'digital' camera and I'm well pleased with it. I'll even share this with you -- at the recent 2011 Memorial Day parade, I don't know how many times and out of pure habit I went to bring the new digital camera up to my eye and then it dawns on me that the 3" viewer is where you frame the pic and there is no "old time" single eye-view gizmo but it gets better -- I take a bunch of parade pics using the 3" screen viewer but did I even remember [equally out of habit] that the digital camera even 'had' a 3.6X 'zoom' lens? Noooooooo! But get this and my point here, while later on reviewing the pics in the camera 3" viewer, my index finger 'accidentally' touched against the zoom lever and the 'standard' pic I'm looking at [and as I originally took the pic] suddenly increased in size! In effect, one can zoom the picture AFTER it's already been taken AND there appeared an icon of a scissors asking me whether I wanted to save the now "edited" picture [while preserving the original 'as taken' pic] and when I clicked 'yes', the 'edited' [read: now zoomed] pic was duly saved in memory! Then I 'discover' that the zoom can be further increased AND the pic can even be 'panned' so that it can be centered or even certain objects taken out! This was news to me! Yeah, I know, and I can hear you from here, to wit, "Hey, Doc! When all else fails, read the manual!" ;-)Couple of things. Don't misplace that USB cable because while the end which goes into the computer is the standard size USB plug, the 'camera' end of the USB cable looks like what I'd term a sort of "sub-sub-mini" plug. It's a 'very' tiny plug that goes into the camera. Without that USB cable, you can't do pic transfers into the computer unless, of course, you want to go the flash memory transfer route [putting the camera memory chip itself into the computer] ==but== you can only do that if your computer 'has' a flash memory reader! Keep the supplied USB cable in a safe place! You might also want to buy a protective holder for the camera because it does 'not' come with one and hey, it's still almost a C-Note to buy so you'll want to protect it, especially the 3" viewing screen from scratches. Finally this, there is a quick read manual that comes with it and the full and lengthy 'explain all' manual is on a CD. The other CD is the Nikon software ==but==  if you have Windows 7 [dunno about Vista or Windows XP], you can use Windows 7 itself to set the thing up if all you want to do is transfer pics into your Windows picture gallery and/or do some minor tinkering with the pic using Windows. I let Windows 7 automatically set it up and it will do that the moment you plug in the USB cable coming from the camera unless you opt to do the Nikon software thing. For my needs and purposes, Windows 7 setting it up in seconds was just fine. If you pay attention to the 'in hand' Nikon "quick start" guide, you should be fine. The camera will also take short duration movies at 30 FPS! The "trash can" icon will dump any pics or short movies you're not pleased with or don't want to keep. Focusing is automatic and the camera has a standard size screw-in gizmo at the bottom to place the camera on a tripod. The flash is built-in and the camera 'sensor' decides [although you can over-ride that where 'you' decide when to use a flash assist] when it's needed and when it's not needed. It also takes out the old 'red eye' thing [with flash] but how it does this escapes me. All I know is that it works! As I said, for a beginner digital camera, I'm well pleased with it and even if you're a pro, it's light weight, reliable [thus far!] and fits in the palm of your hand or T-shirt pocket. Various camera colors are available too. Comes with a tie-on nylon holding cord but 'not' with a camera protective cover. Ironically, the updated L-24 Nikon [with 14.0 megapixels] is presently $5 'cheaper' than the L-22. You may wish to compare the 'updated' Nikon L24 features with the L22 and make the call as to which one you buy although my understanding is that the the more megapixels the camera has, the sharper the image. I also assume that with the updated L-24, the L-22 should further drop in price.Doc Tony

Reviews.Title: Really not impressed
Reviews.Author: Nina Weber
Reviews.Content: After owning this camera for 8 months, I have decided I really don't like it and will be replacing it. It works fine if you're taking pictures outside in broad daylight, but if you want to take pictures of moving objects, or indoors (even with adequate lighting), forget it. The photos turn out grainy and blurry, and most of the settings are useless. You can't tinker with any of the settings so there is not much flexibility at all. I absolutely DETEST the flash: It flashes twice, so if you're taking pictures of pets or children, they will blink on the first flash, and and on the second flash their eyes are closed. So you will very rarely ever get pictures of your critters with their eyes open. You have to take the pictures over and over again and by then your subject is blinded! What's more, is that the flash is way too bright. Pictures come out looking very washed out with the flash on, and with the flash off the pictures come out blurry. There is no happy medium. Before I bought this camera, I had a Canon Powershot, but lost it on vacation (dropped it in the ocean - oops!) I am going to buy another Canon and give this one away.

Reviews.Title: Skip this one!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Page Armstrong
Reviews.Content: This camera has an extremely slow shutterspeed, about 80% of the pictures came out blurry. If you never want to take a picture of a person, get it, otherwise, save your money.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Gordon "Jamie"
Reviews.Content: It's just that, a good camera for the price.Pros: Takes great pictures, price is lower than comparable 12.1MP point-and-shoot cameras, unlike many other cameras I've used the auto-sensor for photo type actually works well.Cons: Takes forever to actually take the picture, not really small, does not come with a rechargeable installed battery, eats batteries (I bought rechargeable AA cells and carry two changes worth.)

Reviews.Title: Sigh...
Reviews.Author: BookNerd Extraordinaire "BookNerd"
Reviews.Content: In October, I dropped my Canon camera with the lens extended and of course, the lens jammed and my beloved Canon became worthless.  Out of desperation for a new camera (Christmas being right around the corner and the fact that I am a blogger, I need a camera!), I needed something that will take decent pictures and I ordered this Canon Coolpix at a great price.The camera itself is very lightweight and with a nice, large screen.  Pictures menu is great.  It's a simple point and shoot digital.  The flash is RIDICULOUSLY bright.  Horrible.  I can NOT get a decent photo of my daughter INSIDE when I need a flash.  Outside using natural light, the photos are great.  The shutter is sllloooooww[...]  Turtle slow.  Coasting in neutral slow.  Oh and let's not forget how long it takes to focus on an image. I didn't expect SLR quality for what I paid and I just expected something decent, which is what I got until right outside of the return window, the zoom stops working.  Yup, I can't zoom.  At all.  Well, unless I nearly want to break the thing, then I can turn the zoom.Oh well.  The Canon T3i is out, so this summer I will be investing in one and donating the Nikon Coolpix L22 to someone who is need of a camera.

Reviews.Title: Waste
Reviews.Author: JJR2
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a birthday gift and I am far from impressed. I only got a new camera b/c my other had broke so I was desperate. My parents picked it out and usually do a good job with electronics however I think my father was sucked in by the cool color. That is the only good thing about this camera.It takes forever to focus and take a picture. It is somewhat confusing to use. The full user manual is a DISC for a computer. What if you wanted to look something up but didn't have a computer nearby? COME ON! And the quick start guide looks like it'd have a lot in it, but it's too busy covering 3 languages in addition to English. Pictures taken in dim lighting that would benefit from flash, apparently don't trigger the flash. About half of pictures come out dim, yellow, grainy, out of focus or a mix of all four. I've taken to using the camera on the portrait setting just so that the flash will come on.I wanted a camera with regular batteries b/c I like to carry extra on me and I don't like dealing with a charger.  This camera also eats batteries like crazy. I can't take over 100 picts and review them without having to find new batteries. My last camera, a Cannon something or other that was like 5 years old hardly needed batteries.LASTLY, my biggest complaint about this camera is the battery door. If you touch bottom every so slightly the door will pop open throwing the batteries all over. Idk how many batteries are lost underneath stuff at my house b/c of this. Sometimes it even throws open with so much force that the memory card gets loose. So don't even bother trying to take this to the bar. With the batteries not staying in, potentially losing your memory card, and the amount of time it takes to get a picture, it's not worth the stress. I would tape the battery door closed but since the camera goes through batteries so fast it's just not worth it.Save yourself the sanity. There are plenty of other cameras out there with a comparable price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L22 Review
Reviews.Author: Gabriel C. Brown "Black Gryphon"
Reviews.Content: I am a world traveler and an avid photographer, I like to have a camera on my person at all times. However, in many situations, I can not carry an SLR with me; this is where the Nikon L-22 comes in. I have, to date, bought four of these cameras. Every time they have broken, it was because of something I did that caused them to break. I continue to buy them because they are cheep, and pretty decent cameras for the price. They power on/respond to input quickly, shoot good 640 by 480, 30fps AVI videos, and take crisp photos relative to other cameras of a similar price. My only complaint with this camera is that the photos taken without flash or in less than blazing daylight situations have abnormally high noise levels, even for a point and shoot! I mean, what's the point of 12mp when all the fine details are hopelessly speckled? Obviously the people who designed this camera assumed that customers would be happier with a camera that compensated for slow shutter speed and the resulting blur with an ultra sensitive CCD. The least they could have done is added some kind of manual ISO control insted of having it perpetually set to 1600...So, all in all, It is a pretty decent camera, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great for Snapshots
Reviews.Author: Larry V. Reitz Jr. "Reitz Digital Imaging"
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional photographer, but I don't always want to lug my expensive camera and camera bag everywhere that I go. If i just want to capture those "Kodak" moments with the family or do still pix of subjects that aren't moving, I can do that with this 12 MP digital camera. It was new, arrived on time, and the price was better than anything in any store anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Focus!
Reviews.Author: D. Doggette "DaveEagle"
Reviews.Content: I have several of these, and have given several to my wife and sons.  We all have had good success with the L series cameras.Several of the lesser ratings talk about blurring of the pictures.  Be aware that these (and many other digital cameras) require you to hold the button down partially for the sensor to activate, measure the lighting and lock into focus.  Then you can snap the shot.  Generally with digital cameras, the "focus box" will change colors-depends on the brand and/or model.  Also...its a classic case of "you get what you pay for".  For lower cost cameras, you will not get the fastest, most responsive sensor system available!Being realistic, I've gotten very good results using these cameras.  Almost all of the Nikon L series CoolPix cameras I have, I've purchased on sale at $100 or less.  For $100 I can not and do not expect the same performance that I get from my $800 DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Good price and quality
Reviews.Author: mari
Reviews.Content: I ordered the camera as gift. It came on time.Easy to use, good quailty pictures, good price, light and slim, really user friendly camera.Was happy to choose my native language in camera's menu.I highly recommend it especially for people who is not familiar with digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfied
Reviews.Author: Pamela G. Scarlata
Reviews.Content: This camera is suppose to be the replacement for the Nikon Coolpix S202.  In my opinion, it's a terrible replacement.  The S202 was much lighter, thinner, easier to use and produced much better photos.

Reviews.Title: Nikon impresses me again
Reviews.Author: M. Massey "Snapshotmelly"
Reviews.Content: First-Praises to Amazon.com on delivery speed. I ordered this product on Dec 11th, 2010 and received it on Dec 14, 2010 with free shipping and handling. I have owned a Nikon small p&S; before but sold it because I wanted a camera with more megapixels. The battery power so far has not let me down. The video quality is very good. The camera is very user friendly especially for someone like me that hates reading instructions. Cons= I don't like  the fact that the memory card is stored at the same port as the two batteries. Zoom photo quality is grainy.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L22
Reviews.Author: J. W. Knecht
Reviews.Content: Great outdoor pictures. Indoor flash pictures are a disappointment. Color is distorted and some fuzziness. My old Olympus FE 170 was much better indoors.

Reviews.Title: Gret
Reviews.Author: Alvaro N
Reviews.Content: good camera, takes good pics, beautiful to the eyesI liked it a lot and works totally fine

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX L22
Reviews.Author: D. Wooding
Reviews.Content: I have been thinking of what to say when reviewing this camera.  I could repeat all the greatness of what other reviews have already said... but I think if I just share one thing, in conjunction with the other reviews, it will sum the Coolpix up.I am legally blind, and I can take great pictures with this camera.ABSOLUTELY would buy it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: Broke 3 weeks after purchase
Reviews.Author: C. M. Mcwatters
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to replace my Nikon Coolpix S230 that had died from the very common "lens error" problem.  Three weeks after arriving, the battery door latch broke.  I had not dropped the camera or used it in any way outside of normal use.  I have taken about 15 pictures with it.  The retailer said that I had exceeded the two week return window, and Nikon said that this part is not covered under warranty.  Repair costs are about the same as the replacement costs.  The camera takes good pictures, but I cannot stress highly enough my dissatisfaction with it.  This is the second Nikon I've had in a year that weren't treated to any abuse but had problems that required replacing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Nancy T. Jensen
Reviews.Content: The camera tries to do everything for you.  It is very slow to zero in, so you better not be in a hurry. So far about 50% of my pictures are out of focus. If you intend to take quick snapshots - forget it.  If you intend to take sports pictures where something is moving - forget it. I wish I had spent a little more and got a camera where I can control the shutter speeds, lighting etc.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: danull
Reviews.Content: Got this camera from my wife's dad - he had bought it for use at a concert and didn't like it so passed it on.Takes a very long time to turn on and a very long amount of time in between shots.  Whenever I'd take a photo where the flash was necessary, I'd wind up with horrible pictures where I couldn't make out what I'd taken a photo of.  When I'd force the Flash off, I'd wind up with blurry photos.  I am not a professional photographer but with a point and shoot camera like this, I expect to turn it on, take a picture, and quickly come away with something useful - that did not happen here as it did with my previous 5 MP Casio.The price was right for me (Free) and I see that Amazon also has this camera for less than 100 dollars - I guess what they say is true - "you get what you pay for".  I'm inclined to go back to my 5 MP Casio until I can get my hands on a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great, small issue with focusing
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: Pros:-fairly simple-pictures have good resolution, very detailed-very convenient & small considering it uses AA batteries-uses very common SD & SDHC cards (I'm looking at you Sony)Cons-sometimes takes out of focused shots in situations where that really shouldn't be a problem; like 15 feet away, outside, on a nice day, with nothing in the foreground.

Reviews.Title: just OK
Reviews.Author: jesse's girl
Reviews.Content: i buy a new point-and-shoot camera about once a year.  i have had 4 fuji's and 1 cannon.  this was my first nikon.  and i was not impressed.  it takes too long to get the camera going...so if you want to hurry up to capture a shot, you can forget about it.  the camera takes about 15 seconds to acutally take the picture.  also, it does NOT come with a memory card of any kind!  not even a small one to get you started...i read the reviews prior to purchasing and somone posted that it did come with a card...but it definitely doesn't...you can however save a few photos to the camera without a card.  the owners info booklet does not say what type of memory card to use.  lame owners manual. sllllllow shutter speed.  sleek look.  above average picture quality. overall its just OK.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures when the flash comes on
Reviews.Author: June Hedger
Reviews.Content: This camera is OK. It takes a pretty good picture when the flash works but that's very inconsistent. For $100 it's not bad. I have heard great things about Nikon and this hasn't held up to that hype. My $50 Kodak easy share was better then this camera.I would pass on this and get something else.

Reviews.Title: Not for Video!
Reviews.Author: Underdrummer
Reviews.Content: I own a Sony Cybershot 7.5 mp that I bought in 2007. The Sony CS is a great digital camera. It was over $200 dollars at the time and I still use it today. I purchased the Nikon Coolpix L22 digital camera as a gift for my Mother after she asked me to have several ziploc bags full of old camera film developed. I am mostly happy with the Nikon. The camera is user friendly and the zoom options are easy to use. The Nikon L22 takes 2 AA batteries instead of using a battery pack. Which I think is better for beginner camera users. The pictures are of good quality but still lacking a certain crispness that you would expect from a "12.0 mp camera. My Sony SC ($200+) is only a 7.5 mp and the pictures look better than the Nikon.  The easiest way to shoot pics is to use the easy-auto setting. The digital flash can get annoying as it seems to need a good 10-15 seconds to "recharge". This can get really old when you are trying to capture say; a sunset or someone opening a gift. What I'm saying is: When timing counts; it sucks to have to wait. Now, the video. The video is terrible. I don't know what Nikon did to mess up the video so bad but it isn't pretty. The options for video output are limited. Standard tv 640 and 320. The color of the video is severely altered and blues will come out green. It also tends to look majorly "overlighted".Imagine you were filming on a stage under stage lights. Bright stage lights. Yeah, bad. So, for the price (around $70). I can't complain too much. If you are switching from an old camera to digital cameras then this would be a good first buy. If not, then get something of higher quality.I would suggest the Sony Cybershot. (Surprise, surprise)I guess I had already been spoiled by a greatly superior camera but hey: "What do you expect for $70"?Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W180 10.1MP Digital Camera with 3x SteadyShot Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Makes a great gift
Reviews.Author: Dhruv Thukral
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera as a gift for someone who is not really a heavy technology user and was planning to go on vacation with a classic film camera. Needless to say this was a really good purchase, and the red color is a really nice touch and is the first compliment you will get.Camera was super easy to setup, just insert the memory card and battery and you are ready to point and click. Picture quality is good enough that you will not really complain unless you are super picky and are a professional, but for most intents and purposes this is a great buy.Makes a great gift for anyone really.

Reviews.Title: Fabuloso!
Reviews.Author: S. Biondo
Reviews.Content: A terrific camera! I got an 8G card to go with it and there is always plenty of room for more pix. The zoom is much better than my previous digital camera. The Nikon software for the computer works great. A really decent back-up device for great memories.

Reviews.Title: Not Great. Not Even That Good.
Reviews.Author: Bailey4622
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because of the price, and I guess you get what you pay for. As another reviewer mentioned, it has a long delay to take the picture after pressing the shutter button. Very annoying. And after using this camera for a long vacation weekend, I noticed that 90% of my pictures are out of focus, which is a huge bummer. I blame it on the long delay.I'm going to get another camera and not use this one. I'd return it if I could.

Reviews.Title: Waste of time
Reviews.Author: Delilah St. Clare
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with hopes of documenting my trip to Peru for cheaper. I'm glad I received the camera before I left because the quality of the pictures was horrible. I tried it out on my kids and the camera couldn't keep up with their pace. The time between shots was slower than slow. The video quality was not up to par, it went in and out of focus when I zoomed. None of the pictures I took were not blurry. I had this camera for 12 hours before sending it back. I can't imagine how frustrated I would have been if I did take it to Peru.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: D. Lerner
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for everyday, point and shoot photos.  The "Auto" settings are a bit over the top but it's easy to switch over to the settings you want.

Reviews.Title: Seems like a great camera until you have to change the batteries
Reviews.Author: D. Ritter "Danny Joe"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my father as a birthday present.  He is in his 70's and never owned a digital camera and it I bought it based on it being simple to use.When I went to load the batteries and put in the SD memory I was disappointed with the access cover.  It's difficult to open and once you get the batteries in its even harder to close.  I was afraid I would break it when I tried to close it as it looked cheap and poorly made.

Reviews.Title: Bad battery cover
Reviews.Author: Allan Brandt "Big Al"
Reviews.Content: battery cover common problem. Plastic Latch breaks, batteries fall out. Only way to take pictures after that is to hold the battery cover in with your hand. Repair costs as much as the camera.

Reviews.Title: Its so so...
Reviews.Author: Jesse R. Stokes "CandyMonte"
Reviews.Content: Sounds like a nice camera, and it is. But i didnt realize it takes two AA batteries , not an internal rechargeable one. So i dont like that . The zoom pretty much dont do anything, if you zoom not too far out, it ends up blurry. But as long as you have batteries and take close pictures, it works great.

Reviews.Title: Poor Battery door design
Reviews.Author: Beatrice B
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera a few months and the battery door has broken. Using tape to keep the door closed and this is not working well.  Would not buy again!

Reviews.Title: Started Nice, Ended Bad!
Reviews.Author: Katherine Petersdorf "Author, Film Producer &...
Reviews.Content: At first I loved this camera, it had a tone of amazing features, lighting, and film features. The reason I gave it a two is because it is easy to break. I had the camera three weeks and I had it in my laptop bag, and my laptop bumped it in the car ride, popped the lense out of place, and made the camera not work. I have never had a camera that could have a lense popped so easy. I would suggest getting a case for it, or buying a higher quality nikon, because it is a good brand. I just should have known better than to buy the cheapest camera I could find :(

Reviews.Title: I expected more
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: I read in the reviews that people were frustrated with the slow shutter speed, but the problem I am having is that the pictures just aren't clear. Probably around half of the pictures I take with this camera are slightly blury. they look fine on the camera, but not on the computer or anything larger. In addition to that, if the lighting is low at all, you can forget about it. I have owned a number of different digital cameras and I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera, and have waited almost a year to write a review because I wanted to get as much field use out of it as I could before I put my opinion out into the world.This is an excellent camera for several reasons.  Battery Life is excellent, picture quality is amazing, and the size is just wonderful.I am required to take pictures of the construction jobsites that my company works on and this camera has made my life a whole lot easier.  The menu to access information that I want added to each picture is simple and very intuitive.  A novice should have no problem with using this camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: ewebb
Reviews.Content: This camera absolutely sucks. My husband and I purchased it to take pictures during our anniversary getaway and it was terrible! It takes forever to focus and take a picture and when it does, it's not of very good quality. Save your money. You'll be sorry you spent it on this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy!
Reviews.Author: John Galt
Reviews.Content: These cameras break down at an alarming rate.  We've replaced the camera two times (3 cameras total - dumb on our part).  These things simply stop working after about six months.  I'm buying a Panasonic now.  DO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Debi
Reviews.Content: Pictures come out blaring red, it takes forever to snap a "special moment" pic  so forget it if your trying to capture a child doing something adorable.....the moment is long gone before the camera decides to "click"  Im going back to Canon......at least I was sure the quality was excellent.  One good feature on this camera is the video capability. It does well taking video's.....Pictures I have tried every different setting but they just seem to be very low quality......any takers, feel free to email me and I'll be glad to give it up.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Curtis L. Crotts
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for a Canon Sure Shot that died after years of giving me excellent service as an inexpensive easy to use camera that took quality photos and videos. I wanted to replace it with another inexpensive point and shoot camera of equal quality and the one I was replacing was no longer made. I saw this Nikon L22 for very good price and trusting the Nikon name purchased it. It has been a big disappointment. My Canon had a sports mode that I used to reduce blur and I could take pictures without flash in very low light and still get bright pictures with correct colors. The Nikon not only has a sports mode but also image stabilization but I can use them together and get a blurred image of an inanimate object. The only way I can get pictures that are not blurry is to use the auto mode with auto flash. But then the flash fires in any setting other than bright sunlight and I end up with pictures that are washed out and colors that are not even close to being correct. They say you get what you pay for but if Canon could make a good inexpensive camera why can't Nikon? The canon also had an instruction book and the controls were so simple it took no time at all to learn to use it. The Nikon comes with a CD only so you have to learn to use it before leaving home and the controls are complicated and buried in layers of screens accessed through the menu button. Want to take a macro shot of a prized flower in your garden? That setting is a sub-setting under sports. Yeah, that's intuitive. If you want a good point and shoot that is inexpensive, look at a camera other than this one.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera hate that battery door broke!
Reviews.Author: adurgin
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera! It takes awesome pictures and is easy to carry. My favorite thing is that it runs on double AA'S which means that while i may shoot pictures for the upwards of three consecutive hours, i do not run out of battery or have to worry about recharging. I gave this camera a low rating because I bought it in June and the battery door hook broke in July IN THE CAMERA CASE! It barely got bumped and now there is no way to keep the batteries in. I had it taped for a while but now I am getting error messages. Sad Sad day! Nikon! Please fix the stupid design of your battery door so I can love your cameras again! other wise it will be back to kodac until I can afford a pro grade.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: itsjoan
Reviews.Content: The Nikon L22 replaced an older Olympus - no viewing screen, just a viewfinder.  While the Olly was a "Better" engineered camera, I never mastered all its functions.  The Nikon is so easy - I have a hunch it does as much as the Olly, just more user friendly.  With the speed electronics update today.....I see no use to spend more $ than I did.  I'm not a professional photographer and the Nikon takes beautiful pix and I'm not out to impress anyone.

Reviews.Title: sometimes, camera is completely worthless
Reviews.Author: taka610
Reviews.Content: The main problem I have with the camera is that it is utterly worthless when taking a picture of something up close. The icon for this picture mode is two flowers, which were impossible to find. I didn't even think it had one at first. When I tried to use it, the camera's auto focus will almost always focus on the background. Automatically. Otherwise this camera is fine. just don't try to photograph anything less than a foot away.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool camera
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: I love this camera for daily use, takes much better pictures than my camera phone. The 12 Megapixel rating will give you great pictures. It has a pretty easy to figure out navigation system and you can easy figure out what you can't on your own if you read the instruction manual. The battery life is decent, but as with all cameras you will want to get an extra. I have used this on my vacation to miami and had great results.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: Zachery
Reviews.Content: This digital camera has been such a great investment for me and offers so much in the way of picture quality, effects, and so many more options. I love photography in general and this camera is so compact and takes awesome pictures !Take care,Zachery

Reviews.Title: Niikon
Reviews.Author: Gary Adams
Reviews.Content: I am kind of rough on cameras so I dont like to spend too much on them.Just got back from vacation and downloaded the pictures from my Nikon.The pictures are excellent for a cheap camera.

Reviews.Title: Buy at your own risk
Reviews.Author: Tmong "tmong"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son in June of 2010, just about 13 months ago. I own multiple Digital SLRs, but this was for he and his mother to use periodically. The camera was taken to a Boy Scouting trip, on a school trip to Philadelphia, and to a few elementary school events. I'm guessing the camera has taken 250-500 pictures in total.The zoom no longer works. It simply stopped. The cost to repair is greater than the cost of the camera. Now the camera itself still works fine, we can take pictures, but the ability to use the 3.6X zoom is gone. I've tried countless internet suggestions/fixes to no avail.Google search "Nikon Coolpix known issues" - lens errors are super common and happen frequently. The # of "out of the box" lens issues is a bit scary.As far as pocket/purse digitals go, this is the worst we've owned (this is our 4th). I had a lot of hope for it. From a form factor perspective, it was perfect and looked great. But it does a terrible job re: image quality and we end up with an inordinate amount of blurred photos compared to our others.Anyway, buyer beware. I'm on my 3rd SLR, 2nd digital (one an 18MP version). While I'm no professional, I know enough about digital cameras to say this one is shoddy at best.

Reviews.Title: Nice cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Zulli "Tazz"
Reviews.Content: After a year of using my old Nikon coolpix camera, I felt it was time for an upgrade. Something a little smaller with more Megapixals. I figured since I am already familiar with Nikon coolpix. I decided to get that. Also it was the cheapest name brand that I saw.Im glad I did. This camera has an astounding, 12mps which is 4 more then my last camera. The size is perfect and it takes great pictures. Now the only flaw is it doesnt have much options with video. The last coolpix camera I had did. But still an awesome camera.Pros:-Great size and weight-12mp-Cheap price-Takes Great picturesCons:-Not much video options

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: coinmanone
Reviews.Content: You better find something to lean against if you want to get a non blurry shot with this one. My 9 year old digital camera with a view finder always takes steady shots. Also after taking each shot you have to wait till that image stops showing on the screen before you can take another picture. There may be a way to turn this feature off. If you can find something to brace the camera on for each shot it will take a good picture. I have let others try it and they hated it. Good luck with this one.

Reviews.Title: awful
Reviews.Author: Eliz
Reviews.Content: This camera is 12 megapixels of garbage.  Every-single-picture-is-blurry.  Do not waste your money, I am incredibly disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: This Nikon lives up to its name
Reviews.Author: Stephen Rustad
Reviews.Content: I bought this for youngest (14) in preparation for her High School band trip. We've been inundated with photos ever since. She's not particularly technologically savvy, nor is she by any means a technophobe, which means that she's probably an average consumer. In any case, she mastered the camera's functions in about an hour. That tells me that the Nikon folks did their homework in designing the camera. Full disclosure - I've owned Nikon SLRs for more than 30 years. That said, the first "pocket" camera I purchased was a Canon for my middle child, also in advance of a school trip. This Nikon is every bit the equal of that Canon in features and performance. Given that Canon overtook and for a time) surpassed Nikon in Digital SLR technology, I consider that high praise.

Reviews.Title: A camera for on the go
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Miguel Rodriguez"
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful for non-professional use.  I received this camera as a Christmas present and the first thing that stood out was it's size.  It is small and very portable but yet it has a big bright and clear LCD screen.  It is an easy to use camera for anyone of any age and it comes with the basic features that are standard in most cameras.  It also uses AA batteries which at first may seem like an inconvenience since I had to buy my own rechargable ones (other cameras have their own specific battery) but ended up being very beneficial because if you ever need batteries while on vacation you can easily buy some ready to go AA's at a nearby store.  I'm not sure sure how good the video quality is since I only use it for shooting photos, but the photo quality is awesome! There are many who have complained that their photos are blurry and when i first experimented with this camera they were blurry.  It wasn't until I switched it to "auto mode" that they became as great as those other good reviews have stated.  So unless you want blurry pictures DO NOT USE "easy auto mode".

Reviews.Title: Poor product that dimishes the Nikon Brand
Reviews.Author: McInva
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product as a gift for a novice photographer, thinking it would be just right for someone just beginning to take photos.  And I relied on the Nikon brand name to deliver a quality product, even at the entry level. Was I ever mistaken! The camera feels as if it's make of cheap plastic and the controls feel toy-like.  The photos produced by this camera are soft and the colors slightly off.  But worst of all, the zoom control lever stopped working after 46 photos. Without a functioning zoom, the camera was useless. I have purchase several digital cameras from Amazon - from point and shoots to SLRs - and have never seen a quality problem like this one.  I returned the L22 to Amazon and declined their offer to send me another one.  I had seen enough of the Coolpix L22 -- and Nikon entry-level cameras.  I have not yet purchased a replacement for this one -- but it won't be a Nikon. And from the high number of 1-star ratings I see for this camera, many others have reached the same conclusion.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: heidijo15
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase of a Nikon camera. The screen gives me the chance to capture wider images and really see the whole picture before I take a picture. There are many features like flash, slight flash, and even different views you can select for indoor or outdoor use. Can't wait to take it on our vacation!

Reviews.Title: Nikon digital camera
Reviews.Author: Glorious "Glo"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my Nikon digital camera. It's easy to use and takes great shots. The value was outstanding -best price online. Compact with a great size screen. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: elizabeth
Reviews.Content: easy to figure out for somebody not camera savvy.  simple to use; just takes some practice to find the right setting for the picture being taken.downside is it needs the card that is not included with this model or else it's "full" after 5-6 pictures.  it also goes through batteries too often.all in all, good camera for general use.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: SLH
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband so he can throw it in his pocket when he goes somewhere and wants to take pictures. I have a big Nikon DSLR camera that is too bulky for him. This is the perfect size and still takes pretty good pictures. I say pretty good only because I'm use the my DSLR. I have had a few blurry pictures when I have taken the photos, but that is only because I'm taking pictures of my moving 2 year old....he doesn't sit still much. Great picture quality and nice size camera. Love the size of the display.

Reviews.Title: A terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the photo quality of this camera is terrible - expect most of your shots to be completely out of focus. It also has terrible light sensitivity and color balance.This is assuming that your camera works to begin with. You can also expect that transfering pictures from the camera to your computer will fail more often than not - after a few months, the camera could no longer be detected by computers, rendering it useless.I would advise that you spend a little extra money for a camera that works - otherwise, you'll find yourself spending as much, if not more, to constantly replace this piece of garbage

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredibly slow with the flash on and off and the picture quality is average at best. It would be well worth an extra $50-$100 spent to purchase a faster, smaller and more more reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix L22 not what I was expecting
Reviews.Author: Boonie shopper "Tina"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas and I have been trying to "like" the camera ever since. I have not had a clear or good picture since I started using this camera. The functions are easy enough to use, but I really hate the delay when I am trying to get a picture. There have been several times that I thought I would capture the image but the delay when I pressed the shutter was about 3 seconds, by that time the picture moment is gone. I also do not like the quality of the pictures and there is nothing that you can do to get the flash to work every time, so most of the pictures turn out very yellow looking and if there is any movement at all, even in sports mode then the picture is very blurry.I will keep this camera because I don't want to upset the ones that gave it to me, and maybe put it in my purse in case of a photo op because it is very small, and easy to use, however for my more serious photos and memories I have purchased a Fuji FinePix s1500 because it is also easy to use and has higher quality photos for those moments that you want to see clearer and brighter. I do think that this camera would be good for a teen who just wants to pose and take pics with their friends.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed!
Reviews.Author: cartwright02
Reviews.Content: We spent the extra money and went for the Nikon because we have always heard good things. Our last 2 cameras were Kodak's and they put this camera to shame. The picture quality is very poor and it just did not live up to the expectations I have for a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: L22 Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Miller
Reviews.Content: The first picture In Easy Auto Mode turned out great and thought I bought a good camera. The next two pictures I took the flash did not go off. The flash would not go off oftener than it did and I missed out on a lot of good pictures. Good pictures. Had to switch to Auto Mode and now it works most of the time. In the Play Back mode the time and date are shown on each picture for five seconds and then disappears. There is no way to turn this off and it is very annoying. Every time you go from one picture to the next it appears again.It is a battery eater and every time I have to change the batteries I am afraid the battery cover is going to break off. Very poor set up. The user's Manual is not very user friendly.  My mistake was not returning the camera before the 30 days expired. I would not recommend the camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality Not Bad if Only the Batteries Didn't Pop Out
Reviews.Author: D. M. AliDinar "Michelle AliDinar"
Reviews.Content: I don't have a problem with the picture quality of the Nikon Coolpix L22, considering this is only a point and shoot camera, however, it is most unfortunate that the camera is nearly useless because the cover on the battery compartment won't stay closed.  I first thought that I had a lemon, but I soon learned that the flimsy latch on the battery compartment is a common problem with this camera.  When examining the camera without batteries you probably won't notice that the latch is weak, but with the weight of the batteries, any slight movement will cause the latch to fly open. The problem is so severe that the batteries literally pop out of the camera while you are attempting to take a picture, that makes this camera NOT SO COOL.

Reviews.Title: over all good but could be better.
Reviews.Author: M. Lilah
Reviews.Content: pros: high resolution photos with brillant colors, shoots best for still frames and landscapes.cons: can't seem to take a photo indoors without blurring, although it's relatively fast for taking digital photos it can't seem to take photos at parties or in other semi dim lighting (even with flash but especially without.) best for photoshoots, out doors and vacation snapshots.Over all a nice little camera has a number of 'auto shoot' modes (beach, portrait, sunset etc). no real manual options. A little pricey for what it is but a great back up camera.

Reviews.Title: Batteries overheat!
Reviews.Author: Namatassa
Reviews.Content: This camera will be returned or trashed if seller will not honor return. The camera gets dangerously hot when batteries left inside for even a short period of time. My child cannot even hold this camera as it is so hot. I did not note an online recall for this item. Unlikely we are the only buyers that have noted this.

Reviews.Title: Value for money!!
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson ""loving amazon shopping""
Reviews.Content: WOW! The camera looks great. I bought it to take pictures of my newborn child and got it just in time. I took all her first shots with it and I was not disappointed.Pros1. Looks great2. Great value for money3. Good picture quality4. Cool features which are a bonusCons1. You have to hold it really still inorder to avoid blurred pictures  Solution: Practice to press the shot button half way before each picture)2. Internal memory is a waste of time (it only holds about 5 pictures)Overall the camera is one of the better cameras below $100 if not the best.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good camera
Reviews.Author: Shac
Reviews.Content: Features and specs are already covered in many reviews. Bought this for my mother and she is happy with it. Having really gotten blurry pics from it but I could understand it happening if your hands are not still. Also don't count on this camera to provide you instant photography there is some delay.Pros:1. Low price for fairly great point and shoot specs.2. Boot up time is very quick for such a low cost camera3. Battery door seems sturdy for a low cost cameraCons:1. Slight delay in processing pics2. Camera feels cheap but at this price point it its fairly good3. very Limited shooting options

Reviews.Title: I like it but i don't love it
Reviews.Author: K's Daughter "LCA"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera especially for the price however there are some annoying attributes.Only certain batteries work for a long period ( in my case Duracell) I don't know if this is a norm in digital cameras,other batteries run down very quickly,the quality of the pics are good most times but some come out very blurry(there is no anti-shake feature I guess),also another really annoying thing it that the flash takes a few minutes to load up after you use it. At night when I want to take pics and need to use the flash I can't take the pics one after the other,the flash has to "charge up".I bought in in September and last December there was a MINOR incident and the screen cracked! It still works but a crack is staring back at me.I'm not a digital camera expert,this is my first one so I don't know the level of durability on digital camera so it may or may not be just an issue with this particular camera. To end on a good note the camera it self its nice,good weight and you do get good pics.For the price it's  not bad.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Property Preservation Companies!!!
Reviews.Author: PJC
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th Nikon Coolpix L22 that we have purchased.  We have bought 3 for our business and 1 for our oldest daughter.  We own a property preservation company, which means that we work with banks who require photo documentation of all work performed.  Many of our clients require photos to be date & time stamped.  You wouldn't think this would be difficult, but after searching every electronics store in our area, we were able to find very few.  Beyond that feature, we have also found that this camera is much faster than the Kodak that we tried & in the field, time is money.  The fact that it comes in various colors is an additional PLUS.  This helps when assigning cameras to different crews.Great camera for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Breckle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mother who has never owned a digital camera or computer in her life.  It was very easy for me to explain to her how to use it and she seemed to pick up on it quickly.  So far she's been very happy with it and has begun taking photo's with this instead of using disposable cameras.  For the price you can't beat it.For those who want any advanced controls and features this camera might be a bit of a dissapointment.  It is definately tailored as a simple automatic point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Overall good camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Ruth Dirks Garcia
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my 16 year old.  We have had an older Nikon Coolpix for years and been happy with it.  The screen, resolution, flash and battery life are much better on this newer model.  The navigation button aren't as user friendly, easier to hit by accident, harder to switch modes. The buttons feel very flimsy and plastic - I'm worried they will break before the actual camera mechanisms do!  But overall very satified. The pictures turned out well and it's a great camera for a teenager.  I need a new camera too and think I will invest the extra 20-40 to get a slightly nicer coolpix that feels sturdier.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: docb394
Reviews.Content: I should have known the price was too good to be true.  I was aware I was buying a simple PHD (press here, dummy!) camera but this has been a disappointment even knowing I didn't pay very much and my expectations were low.  I wanted a camera to take pictures; I have had simple cameras before and was at least pleased with the quality of pictures and camera behavior.  The auto flash feature on this camera is unreliable; I have had pictures where flash was needed and nothing I did could make the flash work.  The auto focus feature is unreliable as well; many still-subject pictures have been blurry and the light has been all wrong because of the errant flash.  I will be ditching this camera as soon as I can buy a new one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon's warranty is shady
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I bought my camera in April 2010 and by August the battery compartment was broken. I sent it in to get fixed and Nikon wanted to charge me 68.50. The camera was great until it fell apart. Can't take pictures when the batteries always fall out. I think what soured me the most was how their customer service treated me and that they wouldn't fix the problem. Will avoid Nikon from here on out

Reviews.Title: Slow but OK
Reviews.Author: David Y. Chomitzky "Littledigger"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for someone. As we used it over the holidays we were dissapointed with the number of great shots that we missed because of the slow reaction time to pushing the shutter button. Some of the pics we did get were blurry since we thoght the picture was already taken when in actuality it was not. It is a good feeling camera as far as weight and compatness. The flash has sufficient power for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: CraftGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a new inexpensive everyday camera that I could toss into my bag or pocket without concern, and I received the Coolpix L22 camera as a Christmas present.  I love this this camera.You do need to spend time getting to know your camera and all of the modes.  Auto only works so-so unless you are outside (or you have excellent indoor lighting conditions) taking snaps with little or slow movement.  After spending an hour or two taking photos inside and outside the house with all of the different modes, I was really able to understand what modes on this camera are best for what situations (hint: the mode names are just general categories, sometimes it is best to use another mode despite what it is named).I am able to take excellent photos inside of my house with this camera. Previously the only way to get a decent photo was with an SLR due to the complete lack of lighting in my house.  I live in a Victorian row house that has very few windows and completely inadequate lighting for pictures.  Also, I can actually take photos of my fish with it which other point and shoot cameras have failed at.I would suggest using SANYO eneloop 4 Pack AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries with this camera due to their low discharge rate.  They will last longer than any standard or rechargeable battery.The Coolpix L22 is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Poor Manufacturing, Do Not Buy!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Nathan Garnsey
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality POOR manufacturingThe battery door latch broke when I replaced the batteries and Nikon will not fix the camera. This was the second set of batteries and the camera is only 2 months old. Nikon service basically said I did not know how to replace the batteries and broke the door latch. This is a very simple process to replace the batteries and the camera worked for a few pictures after I replaced the batteries then the door flew open and would not stay closed because the little Plastic latch hook broke off.Nikon at 1 time stood for quality and support this is NOT the case anymore.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Digital Camera, Coolpix L22
Reviews.Author: Grand2
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest little camera. Got this in blue with the camera case and 4GB card as a Christmas gift for our 13 year old grandson. This is his first real camera (others had been "throw aways") and he had asked for a digital camera to take on a trip being planned for next Spring. He will be travelling to Europe with a class from school; however, they are not allowed to bring chargers for phones, MP3 players or cameras. So, we had to find a digital camera that would operate on batteries and we wanted a known brand name. This litle camera fits the bill and he loves it. It takes great pictures, just point and shoot; for a novice, that's great. He has plenty of time to practice with it and learn other features. The camera case is very sturdy and can be hung off a belt and still give easy access to the camera. We don't think we could have chosen a better digital camera for him. He's happy and we're happy

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: In this price range, you don't expect perfection. If you're looking for the performance and features of a D3X, this is really going to disappoint you. But if you're looking for a camera that fits in a pocket (even when it's in a protective case), is light-weight, has lots of specialized photography modes, and is handy for grabbing high-quality snapshots, you'll be delighted.As is typical for cameras of this form factor, the flash is underpowered. If you have large hands, you might find the camera a bit small but again this is typical for the form factor.Nikon designed the camera to use AA batteries (rechargeable or alkaline), which is a plus because finding replacements is easy and inexpensive.Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: only good for still shots
Reviews.Author: ccarmah
Reviews.Content: This camera is ok for someone that wants to take still shots - such as a bowl of fruit. The shutter is slow where any picture taken of children or animals - will never be clear and always blurry

Reviews.Title: Nice inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Alicia Damron
Reviews.Content: I use an SLR camera and wanted a decent point and shoot for my 9-year-old.  This one is easy for her to operate and takes decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great if you know how to use this
Reviews.Author: Aveek
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera but you have to know how to use this. It takes a little time to focus and you have to allow it to do that. Otherwise your shots will be fuzzy like a 2MP camera. Also you should use it yourself. Anyone else using it might take bad pictures if they are not aware of this problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Pix!
Reviews.Author: B. D. Ogues "DonLee"
Reviews.Content: This camera is just great. Takes great pictures and awesome for everyday use. Using 4GB sandisk ultra II and 2AA energizer NiMH will get an outstanding result. I would recommend this to anyone on budget and looking for light but take great photos.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: bpmmjt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas.  I bought her the Coolpix 203 last year and I absolutely loved it.  She dropped it and it broke beyond repair.  So I ordered this one.  It was a little cheaper.  I used it the other day and it took fabulous pictures.  love it.  This is a very nice camera.  Takes great pictures and it's very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good value sharp images
Reviews.Author: shaun
Reviews.Content: this camera has a lot of good high tech features that really make it simple to take a perfect picture every time in a well lit environment.Pros:Its a good value.Gets the job done nicely.  such pretty pictures of my car lol.Easy integration with software plugging into my laptop to move the pictures and edit them.cons:doesn't do well with moving objects especialy at night.like most cameras i guess it eats up batteries like crazy.Needs a memory card ofcourse.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Parrinello
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera just a month and have taken about 20 photos so far, all on Easy Mode. I've had just one poor photo and that occurred when I shot down a slight incline between some trees where there was an interplay of sun and shade. It's a breeze to operate. I wish it was a bit thicker so I could grip it better.  It's perfect, though, for small hands.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: I happy with the performance of this camera. It seem easy to use. I like to use the rechargable AA batteries. I think it is very good quality Japanese brand Nikon camera. I plan to take pictures to write articles etc.

Reviews.Title: This camera is good for its quality and price
Reviews.Author: Linh "Linh"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago and used in my two trips. Overall its image quality is good. I love the color of images and the wide view of the screen. It's quite easy to use but it still have cons.The most inconvenient thing is the AA batteries. It seems to be cheap in the first place but in the long run, you have to buy a lot of batteries to replace. The second thing is the size. It's not very small and doesn't fit my hands. I can hardly put it in my pocket cos it's quite big. Another con I see in this camera is the video quality. It's not very good as image's. The sharpness and contrast are not very good. The function of capturing movement is very bad. I can't even take a picture of my kid playing with his cat. The pictures are really blur.In general, with that reasonable price, this camera is worth to buy. I will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: RichieRaw
Reviews.Content: and I love it. It's a cool little device, takes gorgeous pictures, and has a ton of options. Coupled with an alright price and an easy to use interface, and you have a winner. The only cons for me, it uses AA batteries, I kinda wanted a rechargeable, but it's not a big deal. And don't forget to get an SD card since it doesn't come with one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael McCorkle
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife, to replace and old digital.  She really enjoys it, and the pictures are amazing!

Reviews.Title: not all sdhc memory cards are accepted by camera.
Reviews.Author: g8trman
Reviews.Content: 1. Not all sdhc memory cards are accepted by this camera.2. Long (relatively speaking) time in cycling for next shot.3. Too many menus for me.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Krromz
Reviews.Content: For the price it's very good but, the LCD in the camera it's very poor quality the pictures it's not that clear

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: T. la
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. With two batteries I took 25 minutes video & 180 pictures at high resolutions and the battery still show 2 bars left. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: M. H. Chen "MChen"
Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best price of this camera after I seached for several providers. The quality is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Sergey Trofimenko
Reviews.Content: Great camera with all necessary features for beginner (and even more advanced). I purchased this camera as a gift for my friend, and it works great. It looks like the best combination of quality and price. Also, I received this camera in no time - literally, on next day.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L22
Reviews.Author: EnnEssE "Tech Wizard"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!It was difficult making a decision regarding cameras in this price range;  Canon, Olympus, Fuji, Samsung, Nikon, Kodak, Polariod, etc., etc., etc.All had 5 star ratings, and all had 1 star ratings.I based my decision on having had a old Nikon F1, and how much I enjoyed using it.So, I chose the Nikon, and I am glad that I did!I find this camera easy to use, and it takes excellent pictures.Keep in mind that I am a casual photographer, and that the pictures I am taking are for person use, as well as ebay/craigslist.The camera interfaces easily with my XP Pro, Vista, and Windows 7 desktops, and uploading is a breeze.I recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive, easy to use, quality digital camera.

Reviews.Title: not working
Reviews.Author: M Ryan
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to use this camera for holiday pictures, however I ended up using my cell phone camera, as per usual. This camera arrived promptly, however, once I put brand new batteries in it, it read "batteries exhausted" within minutes. I put a second set of new batteries into the camera, and the same thing happened. I would like to return the camera as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: Slow shutter, grainy low light pictures and poor zoom
Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: The camera had 4 stars on amazon, so I thought it was a safe to put on my wish list.  After getting the camera for Christmas, it quickly became apparent that the camera was definitely low end.  The first 5 pictures that I took were blurred beyond recognition because it took about 3 seconds to take them AFTER pushing the button.  To make matters worse, the camera will NOT zoom out.  This isn't a hardware issue, but instead a software issue; the camera tries to recognize faces, stabilize the image for movement as well as auto select an optimal scene selection.  All these things happening together takes up so much of the cameras processor that it can't activate the servo to zoom in.  turning these things off and selecting a scene mode improves this, but doesn't fix it completely and at that point you've turned off the main selling points of the camera.  After putting it on a tripod and having everyone sit still in a well lit room, the pictures were still incredibly grainy and some were still blurred.  There are other sub $100  cameras on Amazon; do you research, check Cnet reviews and buy something else.  You'll be far happier with a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Gift for Mom or Dad
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy "TG Review"
Reviews.Content: In response to other comments.1) Excellent reviews and it takes AA batteries.2) This make a perfect gift for someone (mom/dad/birthday/christmas).3) A camera when you use it abroad when travelling w/o US outlets because it take batteries.4) Another good thing is a little wider for people with weak arms to carry.5) Low price and quality for Point-and-Shoot camera.I would recommend this to another person.

Reviews.Title: Slow acting camera
Reviews.Author: J. Vidal "Free the Planet"
Reviews.Content: I got what I pay for nothing fancy but it those the job. This was a gift for my mom and she likes how easy it is to use from her previous cam. She love the big lcd display. Only complain she has it takes too long to focus and snap the shot. Oh excellent delivery and tracking status.

Reviews.Title: Too Bad
Reviews.Author: Santamedic "Santamedic"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera after doing some homework, and reading the reviews. Between the Nikon name, 12MP and compact size, we thought we could not go wrong for the price. Well after several months, I have read the instructions, used some tips I found on the web, and the verdict is this is a piece of junk. Blurry pics, bad in low light, extremely slow. The only pro is that it does not kill batteries to quick. Overall, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 1 week
Reviews.Author: D. Cavins
Reviews.Content: This item lasted 1 week, camera jamed and would not turn on, returned to Nikon and was informed this problem was not covered, and it would cost me 85.00 to repair.

Reviews.Title: Returned it because of poor image quality
Reviews.Author: steps2006 "steps2006"
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony 5MP camera and a Canon 10M camera, their image quality were reasonably good. This time I decided to buy this Nikon 12MP camera. After several shots, I found out that this Nikon camera was slow, constantly a little bit out of focus, and the photos, when you zoom to 100% size, always look so blurred compared with old Canon 10MP camera.  Finally decided to return. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Michael Krieger
Reviews.Content: The camera tends to be hard enough to get any clear pictures. Almost all my pictures are blurry; I think the fact this camera has no image stabilizer really lowers the picture quality... and upon further inspection I couldn't believe I could have got a Canon that took better pictures for $25 more.

Reviews.Title: My unhappy review
Reviews.Author: irus lekzseh
Reviews.Content: this camera takes pretty good pictures although it can do better. i got a lumix camera after this one because it was BAD! the battery cover boke within 2 weeks. i didnt do anything wrong. since the battery cover was broken it didnt open it only opened when i held it down. it was very annoying to have to take pictures and hold the cover.

Reviews.Title: HUGE bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: David L. Laidig
Reviews.Content: This thing is just nutz! Put the batteries in it and start using it. It has very self evident controls. Video is amazing. Old fart here: took it too a James Taylor concert! The video I got in there is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it looks
Reviews.Author: BILLPRO
Reviews.Content: Lots of Mega but the quality actually goes down with the higher resolution. It has difficulty when there is a high contrast change in the pic. If very sunny and also have shade in the same pic, they both loose quality, the sunny will show glare, and the darker will loose detail.What I like, it's large size screen, it's video ability, and it's a nice looking camera.  Take a lot of pictures, and discard many of them. This is not a reliable point and shoot camera, so just keep shooting. I got mine used, it took a very long time for delivery, longer than promised, and it didn't include the usb cable. Not that it mention that it did, but I would have expected to mention that it didn't.I got it for around $53.00 including tax and shipping. I wish I had gotten a new olympus for the same price.But having said al that, not a bad camera for $53.00

Reviews.Title: Battery compartment - flimsy clip broke
Reviews.Author: David R. Cline
Reviews.Content: Had this camera about 2 months before, while changing memory (in the battery compartment) the tiny plastic clip broke off (about the size of a rats tooth). Camera is now garbage.

Reviews.Title: Shop cameras
Reviews.Author: Donna Kaczynski "DonnaBee"
Reviews.Content: With the purchase of these 2 cameras, it brings our total up to 6.  We use these cameras at work to capture progress of jobs, new improvements on equipment, etc.  These cameras are easy to use for people who don't usually take many pictures.  Would recommend this Nikon model (Coolpix) to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Absolute junker
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Engweiler
Reviews.Content: I ordered this at the end of October for my daughter's Christmas present. Within the first two weeks of use (in January) we noticed the battery door was not staying closed properly. The latch didn't appear to be strong. I contacted the company who told me it would still be covered under Nikon's warranty (but not Amazon's), and mailed it in with a service invoice.  I just received a bill for the repairs ($72) to fix a latch on a $100 camera. I called customer service, to speak with someone who very rudely spoke over me at every turn, and was told that they wouldn't fix it because it was damaged.  They wouldn't even return it to me without me paying shipping and handling to get it back.  I will never buy a Nikon camera again.

Reviews.Title: I Don't Recommend Getting this Camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Coleman "Geek Girl"
Reviews.Content: I would normally check CNET or Amazon Reviews before purchasing something of this nature but didn't because I purchased this camera on a whim in Wal-Mart. I agree with all the 1 star reviews but chose to give this camera 2 stars because I was able to get some decent pictures out of it. I will never purchase a Nikon Cool Pix camera EVER again for the following reasons that I've listed below:We just got back from taking a family vacation over Spring break and this camera has given us nothing but problems.  The top of the line batteries don't last very long in this camera.  We constantly had to change out the batteries.  I was hoping to get better usage from the batteries and bought this camera thinking it would be more convenient than carrying around our lithium rechargeable battery camera.The flash on this camera is insufficient. There are times when it does not work and when it does, it whitewashes the entire picture!  I have experienced delay times when going back and forth between the different modes. Most of all of our pictures came out blurry regardless of whether or not the person was standing still.  You could be standing absolutely still and the picture will still come out blurry! There is a delay between the time you snap the picture and when your actual photo shows up on the screen.  I've also noticed that the shades in colors are also different on the LCD screen which is very frustrating.  We constantly had to retake pictures.  I've had to delete so many pictures.When using the provided USB cable to connect the camera to my laptop several issues occurred.  I kept getting error messages.  At first I thought it was my computer so I rebooted and tried again and got the same error messages.  I also tried on a desktop and encountered the same problems.  It took me forever to transfer pictures to my computer because an error message kept popping up stating, "L22 is busy" or "Your device is not functioning properly" and once the error appeared, the camera would lock up my system and then I would have to use the task manager to close out the program.  It also locked up my desktop computer when I tried using it on there.  When I was finally able to get it to work, I would still get the error message and if it didn't lock up my system, it would knock me out of the program and I would have to start over with the photo transfer!  I was finally able to transfer photos after struggling with it for over two hours!  That is totally unacceptable.  I haven't had a chance to read through the reviews to see if any other members experienced these same problems but having dealt with all these issues, I can honestly say that I will never ever purchase another one of these cameras again!  I recommend you don't purchase this piece of junk either.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Landry "singer/songwriter"
