Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my nephew for Christmas and he loves it.  The only thing I missed was noticing that the camera didn't come with either and case or a memory card.  My nephew, who is 13, didn't have much fun on Christmas taking pictures without a memory card but I quickly went online to get him one which was only seven dollars.  I also got him a case in matching blue for twelve dollars and now he's set to go.  The picture has a great screen and the colors and clarity of his pictures are really nice, maybe even better than my 4 year-old Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Cool Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Christmas mom
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use & upload your pix. You have to take time taking your pictures. Some come out blurry if you don't take the picture slowly. I got this for my husband to use on his jobsites and he is very happy with the ease of use and that he can tuck it in a pocket when he is done.

Reviews.Title: carry cam to supplement dslr
Reviews.Author: Roy E. Carter
Reviews.Content: I use a dslr when I intend to shoot and only rarely use a point and shoot. The reason I got this cam was to have something small to carry around for the "just in case" moments; for example, on Christmas day I went disc golfing in the snow, and it would have been nice to take a few pics to post on facebook. The problem was that there was no way I was going to lug my 20d with a $700 dollar lens around in the snow for a few hours to get a few random pics. So I hit wal-mart and looked for something small, that took regular batteries, and could be stuck in a pocket or disc golf bag, and was cheap. This cam was the lowest priced item to fit the bill.I'm not a pro, but I regularly use a 20d or 40d (canon rules in dslr cams), have good glass, use a good flash, shoot only in RAW mode, fairly proficient in photo shop, and spend a good deal of time taking pics and post processing, so I have pretty high standards. I've also had a few p&s;'s, which take good pics in daylight, horrible pics indoors, and with the flash, take horrible pics in the opposite direction. So here's my review.....not comparing to dslr's, but in getting a decent pic in situations where you're not intending to shoot, but tucked a cam in your pocket just in case something interesting pops up.I set the cam up for the highest quality jpeg (memory is cheap, 4 gig cards are only $10 and hold over 500 pics). put the cam in auto mode, and disabled the flash. The controls are dirt simple, and except for the jpeg quality, can all be done easily with the buttons on the back of the cam. ISO is set internally and you can't mess with it; it seems to stay on the low end, which is normal for outdoors, gives a seemingly slow shutter speed indoors. With a little care to hold steady, I got fairly sharp pics at 1/6 sec shutter speed ( slow shutter leads to blur because you move during the time it takes to snap the shot). There is obvious noise reduction built in which give the pictures a "smooth" look, but cuts out a lot of the graininess that you get shooting indoors. All this means that the pics kind of have a little blurry look inside in low light, but for what your using, it's not all that bad. It looks to me that the outside pics have a touch of this also, but still yields acceptable pics. Outside, the auto white balance is good, inside during the day auto seems good too. Night need the setting changed to the type of lighting and its pretty good. If you don't change it you get the reddish orange hue to the pics. If you use the flash, you get that blown out look all p&s;'s have; too me it's just not pleasing. The exposure comp. matches what you see in the display and lets you get decent shots when theres back light situations. If you're a post processor you can get even dramatically better results if you know what you're doing.Overall, knowing what the limitations of this kind of cam are, I am impressed. If you understand exposure and how light works, you can get pretty darn good shots with a few button clicks. If you don't, the auto mode guesses what you're trying to do and gets it mostly right. If you are serious about photography, these types of cams aren't for you as a primary cam. If you're looking for something better than a phone camera thats cheap and easy to use, this fits the bill. If you're a serious photography looking for something that stays in the glove box or a coat pocket so you can get a shot without having something the size of a toaster hanging around your neck, this is a good cheap solution.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing upgrade from the L18
Reviews.Author: Chatoyance
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon L18 for 3 years and it was a pretty good camera. I put up with the slow shutter response time in hope of it being better with the next model. After taking over 15,000 pics with it, it died, and I got the L22. It has been a disappointing replacement. The shutter response is even slower than the L18 and it requires even more 'perfect' conditions to get a good pic. I had to replace the first L22 I got because even with a tripod, it took blurry pics. The replacement was better, but still a lesser image than my old L18, even with higher pixel res.

Reviews.Title: Nikon doesn't honor the warranty
Reviews.Author: Novamama
Reviews.Content: The camera is compact, easy to use, and took decent though not amazing pictures for the first nine months I owned it, but then it just stopped working.  The warranty, which theoretically covers the camera for 1 year, turns out to be worthless -- worse than worthless, actually, because you have to pay money to ship the camera to Nikon, for them to tell you that it will cost you more than the cost of a new camera for them to repair it DESPITE THE WARRANTY.  I used to have a high opinion of Nikon; my father had a Nikon SLR when I was growing up and I loved it.  But I would never buy another product from a company whose products break within a year and who refuse to honor their warranty.

Reviews.Title: Initial review
Reviews.Author: David A. Gilliam "ClassififedDSA"
Reviews.Content: This is my initial review. I plan on making another after I have had the camera for a while.The camera is very easy to use, I figured it out without the manual. The picture quality is excellent and very realistic; and it is not grainy like other cameras. Now it only has about 12MB of built in memory, but it has an SD card slot inside the battery compartment, and therefore I put my 2GB card inside it. The software it has does install slowly, but that is irrelevant to the camera. Just connect the camera to the computer with the provided cable and turn the camera on (the camera must be on for windows to recognize it)and windows should load the driver software. After that just navigate through the folders inside the camera and then you can copy your images. The folders are a forward path so navigation shouldn't be difficult. The camera is amazing and has some automation features, and the clarity is very fine.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy For The Buck.
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Moore
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Also own the L11, another great little camera.I think I'll stay with Nikon. For quality and price there's no comparison.

Reviews.Title: NOT a good point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera thinking it would be as good as our late Panasonic Lumix of the same price. We were sadly mistaken. Pictures are blurry and colors are not true. Could it be fixed by modifying the settings? Possibly. We are not pros though and were looking for the same out-of-the box quality that Lumix provided. We will be returning it today.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: BethAline
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, convenient size, excellent price.  The continuous shot is useful if you have a golfer in your family!  I have been very happy with it, and only have had a couple of times that things are not in focus, but I think I have to get to know the choices of settings a little better.  Takes great close-ups of flowers, etc.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Cathy Brogdon "Cathy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use, and has some great features for the price.

Reviews.Title: 100% satisified
Reviews.Author: Mary H. Mann
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera had one just like it wore it out,works great,service was also great totally happy customer with the whole purchase and service.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!
Reviews.Author: LaTasha
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera about 5 years and I LOVE it! I've never had any problems with it. I recommend this camera over any that I've had in the past! (I've had 3 or so others). it's a wonderful product for a wonderful price. I've dropped this camera several times and it still seems new only with small wear and tear. doesn't even have scratches for a 5 year old camera..looks under 6 months old

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dwight Miller
Reviews.Content: Have used Nikon equipment for many years and this camera is a neat point and shoot camera to use in many different areas.

Reviews.Title: Very weak.
Reviews.Author: Jose Luis Salazar
Reviews.Content: sensitive material where the battery is inserted, is broken from first use, everything else very well, taking photos quality. thank

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD GIFT FOR MY NIECE.
Reviews.Author: Onesimo
Reviews.Content: Oh, it really was a very good and soo cheap gift for my dear niece Andrea.  She has enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: SteveV "steve"
Reviews.Content: What can I say its easy to use the price was right and its now 3 yeard old.  Best part it takes Std AA batteries.  Use the energizer litium they last a year

Reviews.Title: Not for me!
Reviews.Author: Norma J. Whalen ""book  buzz""
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the pictures that I got with this camera.  The pictures were not of the quality I usually get from my cameras.  I used it once and called Amazon (while I was on vacation in the Keys!) and had them send me the Canon Power Shot SD7801S.  What a difference!  I didn't use it again and finally sold it!

Reviews.Title: Blue Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Michael D. McDonald
Reviews.Content: I went by the photo of the blue Nikon Coolpix, which shows an item in excellent condition; which is what I wanted. As I already own the same model in red that I purchased a little over a year ago from Amazon; I figure it would be another great buy. However this one isn't in near the condition of my red Nikon Coolpix L22. This one is badly scratched all over, the battery compartment still has dust in it and most of the lettering is worn off of the back. Now I understand that the Camera is used but this goes way beyond used conditions., the chrome is badly scratched up as well as the body of the camera; and as I stated the lettering on the buttons is almost worn off.. However the camera was shipped and received promptly, but I am sorry it will have to be returned.

Reviews.Title: Great glovebox camera
Reviews.Author: Allan Pudlitzke
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a glove-box camera for my car. Works great for walks when you forget the DSLR and is handy if you encounter any traffic altercations.

Reviews.Title: Loved this camera
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Root "Jeanne"
Reviews.Content: I have carried this camera for many miles on my horse taking pictures of our rides.  Nikon makes a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Batteries have to be taped to stay in
Reviews.Author: Bob Harris
Reviews.Content: I don't know how long we have had it but now when in use the batteries fall out without tape. BH

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: mark d skeene
Reviews.Content: easy to use and compact.  I thought the picture quality was very good.  Bought this for a trip to Europe, it was just the right size and a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Adelina "Adelina"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes true to life pictures with great colors. I really love it and did not expect such great photos from such a cheap camera. It my favorite all time camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: larcham
Reviews.Content: One of the best cameras I have ever owned-I use it for Ebay pictures and other things-very clear and easy to download pictures to Computer

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.
Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: This product was highly rated so I bought it.  The zoom is too slow and I miss too many pictures because the moment is gone.  And even when it does take the picture, it is still not in focus.

Reviews.Title: disposable camera
Reviews.Author: Peggy G.
Reviews.Content: great camera while it lasted... lens cover stuck after less than 6 months and cost more to fix than camera was worth... kind of a disposable camera

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, but has a terrible battery life.
Reviews.Author: S. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the batteries.  It takes AA batteries and it goes through them very quickly.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Pierre J. Rioux "Main Sail"
Reviews.Content: This camera is used daily to document incoming and outgoing mail and parcels in our shipping & receiving department.  It has worked flawlessly during the time we have been using it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: I have several Nikon L series cameras.  They all work great and this is no exception.  The large view screen is easy to see outside which helps me on trips across country.

Reviews.Title: good product for the price.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Good for the money when I purchased, much better products are on the market now for less money. I would not buy this today.

Reviews.Title: The best camera out there
Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in 2011, and i still use it today. Its a pretty rad camera, and considering the price tag, you'd be a fool not to buy it. Lots of picture options, zoom is AMAZING, and the screen is a very good size for reviewing images. I've had my fair share of accidental droppings, and this camera still runs smoothly. The only problem i've EVER had with this camera is the batteries. Do not use cheap ones. Rechargeables, or Duracell, or even Energizer are the best ones. Cheap batteries only last for a few minutes, therefor shutting the camera off mid action.. Overall this camera is worth every penny. 10/10 would buy again.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: John G. Aicher
Reviews.Content: The first digital camera I owned, - does the job beyond expectations.  Now, if I could only interpret the directions ...

Reviews.Title: Takes a few good pictures... Just get an iPhone.
Reviews.Author: ALEXANDER BREUER
Reviews.Content: The camera looks nice - that's about its only redeeming quality.  But I'm paying for quality, not looks.  You have to hold the camera completely steady unless you want blurry photographs.  I got this for my girlfriend and she likes it, but we recently both got iPhones, so now the camera just collects dust.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Molly M.
Reviews.Content: Button has lettering rubbed off and the strap was missing, but other than that the camera is perfect. I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: battery compartment latch doesn't stay closed
Reviews.Author: frugalgal
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes good pictures.  However, after a few months of use, the battery compartment latch does not work.  The latch opens unexpectedly and the batteries fall out.  [sometimes happened while I was taking a picture]  I have been using a rubber band to hold the compartment closed; but will soon be buying a new camera and it will not be a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: It is really just okay
Reviews.Author: John Giordani "John Giordani"
Reviews.Content: It is a very entry level Nikon. I mean really almost a point and shoot. the 3.6x Optical Zoom is just better than nothing. But, everything is backed by the big name, the quality of the assembly and lenses. It's okay!

Reviews.Title: A few problems
Reviews.Author: Patterson
Reviews.Content: I have owned and used this camera for 2 1/2 years. The pictures I get outside have been great. Inside with lower light, not so good. I dropped it once and it hit on the battery/card corner, breaking a tiny plastic clip that holds the door closed. Ever since I have needed to keep it closed with tape. I am now shopping for a new camera, but likely will stick with Nikonn

Reviews.Title: Wrapped in Newspapers!!!
Reviews.Author: Gica Gab
Reviews.Content: I could hardly believe my eyes when the box arrived and in in was a beaten up camera box and in it, I accessory- the CD, even though other accessories had been listed. But the biggest shocker, THE CAMERA ITSELF WRAPPED IN NEWSPAPERS!!! I was so shocked and disappointed. The camera was for my niece who was graduating. When I contacted the seller, their answer was that the packaging in the camera box was missing, so they did not want the camera to be moving around in the box. Basically, they could not spend the 3.99  to get packaging material. I cannot trust that the camera is working, did not even bother, A DEFINITE RETURN!! Note to seller: Have a better sense of sale and give your customers better presentation. Newspapers!! Really?!?!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: NikkiB
Reviews.Content: This camera served me so well and still does when I don't use my phone (phones may soon be to cameras what the internet is becoming to TV!).  I only stopped using it because the battery door latch broke, so I had to start sticking it with tape or wrapping an elastic hair band to hold it down - not tres classy.  However, it's still working!

Reviews.Title: good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Scott Morande
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera for the money next time we will by a video recorder that takes pictures so we can get better video

Reviews.Title: A gift for a non-technical elderly person
Reviews.Author: HSH
Reviews.Content: This camers is very easy to handle. Size and weight are perefect and battery use requires no charger. Memory chip is available and can easily be downloaded.Best is that the two top buttons ( on-off and focus-snap ) are all that is needed when camera is set for automatic operation, including flash )My gift was received with great enthusiasm and has been put to full use immediately.- and it takes pictures with good color rendition and excellent clarity.

Reviews.Title: Quality poor.
Reviews.Author: J. Pounds "dgrsjim"
Reviews.Content: Would not buy again. Very fragile battery compartment. The buttons are too small for my hands. Will not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great deal and great service
Reviews.Author: Dustin Felix
Reviews.Content: In better shape and faster than I expected. The camera takes excellent pictures and I'd buy another in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: I Loved This Camera
Reviews.Author: Austin Lee Cain
Reviews.Content: This camera was my best friend in the woods and at celebrations. I carried it everywhere, it took great pictures in the worst conditions. I eventually sold it to a friend because she needed a decent camera to take pictures of her girls. She was extremely happy with it and I got nearly a full return on the purchase price. This camera is a winner in my book.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Drkiller
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my purchase of this camera. Its descent priced and the pictures are good quality and I can upload them with the USB port that comes with it. Good recommend.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Camera was OK, but I needed more resolution and sharpness so gave this one away and went to a Nikon D800

Reviews.Title: working :)
Reviews.Author: Violet Everidge
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it takes awhile to focus, BUT overall Im loving having a camera that works and i can take pix of my son!!! :) VERY HAPPY!!! Thank u Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality is Poor =(
Reviews.Author: Catherine Naylor
Reviews.Content: The stabilization and picture resolution sucks! I had another Nikon Coolpix before and liked it a lot more. This Coolpix left me disappointed! I Recommend you spend $20-30 more a get a better Nikon or another camera model altogether.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: John P. Kormanec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought the Nikon Coolpix L22 as a birthday present for our son and we are very happy with the quality of the photos it takes.  Auto-focus is precise (the Nikon lens doesn't hurt either), producing good image sharpness.  Color balance and saturation are very good too.  Zoom is fine for most everyday photo situations (vacations, birthday parties, nature hikes, etc.)  Exposures are accurate in normal light but can be manually adjusted in tricky light situations (the flash falls off quickly after 10 feet, but that's typical for a camera of this type and size).  Lots of different picture taking modes to play around with (besides full auto), which allows you to experiment and have fun too.  I saw several complaints about this camera using AA batteries, so I purchased a Sanyo eneloop AA 4-pack and charger combo for ~$15.  (They last a good long time with "normal" usage and paid for themselves after the 3rd charge.)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce C. Wood
Reviews.Content: Simple easy to use camera, great pictures! Going to let my father in law use it when he goes on vacation, he should have no problems!!

Reviews.Title: The product Camera worked good and was in good condition
Reviews.Author: Annette Parrish
Reviews.Content: The camera was in good working condition and overall  outward apperance was in great condition. Thank you for keeping you word.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: David Haverfield
Reviews.Content: Worse camera I ever bought! Would never suggest this camera to anyone, do not waste your hard earned money !

Reviews.Title: Wish I had read the reviews first
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Was a great camera until the battery door broke. Same thing happened to one that I gave my mom as a gift. Seems this happens often to these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good product.
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I didn't want an expensive camera. I am not a professional photographer and I don't need professional quality pics/video. This is great for taking everyday pics like at a concert or outdoors and etc. This is a good digital camera and it is also my first. I would recommend this to first time camera buyers. I wouldn't  recommend this to people looking for HD quality and crystal clear quality.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced good camera
Reviews.Author: Manash
Reviews.Content: I purchased it as a gift to my friend and I must say the he is very happy using it.

Reviews.Title: Not up to Nikon Standards
Reviews.Author: ELT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had batteries so I thought that would make it easier to charge.  The problem is that the door flap where the batteries go pops open all the time for no reason.  Which is a real pain when you are trying to take pictures.  I actually taped it closed.  I though buying a brand name like Nikon I'd get better quality.Other than that issues, it's a nice little camera.  Unfortunately that issue caused me to hate the camera so much that I bought a new one.

Reviews.Title: superb little camera
Reviews.Author: chicos mom
Reviews.Content: i bought this same camera but in a different color at walmart in june 2011. it takes very clear, sharp pics. my daughter is good with a camera and she uses the camera almost daily to take pics up close of her jewelry to sell. she loves it and never mentioned any problem with the camera. we were buying batteries frequently until we bought a wall charger and charged our own batteries to use in it. i think its a great camera so far. and i have recently bought a used L22 and it takes wonderful pics too. cant say what will happen in the future but would recommend this camera to anyone.thanks

Reviews.Title: Buy a different one
Reviews.Author: aragon81
Reviews.Content: I've had several digital cameras over the years and this one is the most disappointing by far. This one makes me long for the days of the disposable camera as I think I got better pictures with those. There is an obnoxious lag in the operation of this camera that becomes extraordinarily frustrating when you need to capture a moment on-the-fly. Even when you have all the time in the world to get a good shot, the focus is all over the place and you'll get one good picture out of a dozen tries.It's also bulkier than all the others I've owned and goes through batteries like an SUV goes through gasoline. I considered giving the Nikon Coolpix L22 2 stars, but after adding in all the frustration this waste of money has given me, 1 star seems sufficient. This camera should come with antacid.

Reviews.Title: camara de calidad
Reviews.Author: nestor pereira
Reviews.Content: rapido y seguro el servicio me gusto el producto porque era justo lo que vi es justo lo que me llego

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Averill "SEAN'S REVIEW"
Reviews.Content: The indoor pictures are yellow no matter what adjustments you try.I expected so much more from a Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA, GOOD, NOT THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Steven S. Abadi
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT IT YEARS AGO AND AT THE TIME IT WAS NICE AND CHEAP, BUT IT WASNT NEARLY AS GOOD AS WHATS IN THE MARKET TODAY BUT THEN I WOULD RECCOMEND BUYING IT BUT NOW, NO NEED THERE ARE BETTER ONES OUT THERE

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: HKirsh
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price. Easy to operate and takes decent pics. Had it for over a year and works better and lasted longer than my old Canon.

Reviews.Title: This product worked great for a while.
Reviews.Author: Kayla B
Reviews.Content: Poorly made. I treated the product very well, it doesn't have a scratch on it. The batteries die very quickly, and they pop out when I try to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating tool for picture-taking
Reviews.Author: J. kingman
Reviews.Content: The battery compartment broke after about 3 weeks of very light use. Now the batteries pop out all the time at the slightest touch. I've had to tape it closed, or use elastic, which then gets in the way of the controls. That's my prime complaint, and it sounds like many people have had the same experience. Shame, shame on Canon, who produces other fine models. It's such a fiddly defect in design that one would not expect from this manufacturer.The other is the button/menu layout. I had an earlier coolpix model which was much easier to navigate and made more sense. Why 2 buttons to toggle between picture-taking mode and picture-viewing mode? It sounds minor but it isn't. The zooming in/out is sluggish. Directing it to taking close-ups/macros is an exercise in futility, as it won't often "see" what I'm trying to focus on, even when the subject is exactly centered in the lens. Really annoying!Picture quality is fine for the average person, but I would recommend spending your money on a different model. I don't feel that the camera is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: I like cheap, but useful, cameras
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: If one of my cameras break, I get the latest version of COOLPIX. Any camera over $100 is not worth the money, for most amateur photographers.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Terry Fisher
Reviews.Content: This was such a great camera that I bought another one for my daughter as a birthday gift.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Kenne
Reviews.Content: Has a rather weak looking cover for batteries and seems it would be easily broken so maybe not a good camera for kids. Takes great pictures though.

Reviews.Title: so so
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: I like to take pics of fall foliage.  When the leaves are yellow on a bright day they give off a very special glow - which is not captured correctly on the camera screen.  But the pictures are correct when downloaded.But - considering the price - not bad at all.  See this page - all the pictures were taken with this camera.[...]

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Brian400
Reviews.Content: I bought this little camera partly because of the "Nikon" name and also because of the featuresIt's too bad I didn't read all the unhappy reviews first.I've noticed the same problems.Slow shutter; but primarily bad color reproduction. The other big problem is with the focusing system when trying to take close-up pictures, it never will focus on the subject and comes out blurry.It's a cool little camera but has too many flaws to ignore.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: This is a $100 camera, so I did not expect the world.  BUT....I was surprised by the slow shutter speed, default flash setting (even when I turn flash off manually), close up feature is not impressive and the most annoying feature....many of my pics seem to get corrupted before uploading them to my computer.  The correlation with that last one is...if I delete pics on the camera, when I go to upload others get corrupted.  Weird.  Too many issues to be associated with a Nikon.  I am moving on, and recommend you do too.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever Had
Reviews.Author: pamela Springer
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I have ever purchased. I have had it for almost two years now. It takes great photos, but at it's age, it's starting to get wear and tear, but I guess that's normal. The focusing can be SLOW at times, but it usually does turn out good results, which I guess is worth the wait. Before, I always used 35MM film cameras, but they are going by the wayside, and I needed a way to put the pictures on the computer. All in all, this is a great little digital camera, but at this time in 2012, there are much better options. In 2009/2010 perspective, this was a top of the line point-and-shoot. Will be heading for maybe a FUJIFILM FINEPIX X100 next, but will still be keeping my Nikon L22 for quick shots!!

Reviews.Title: Battery door design flaw
Reviews.Author: Mortimer Snerd
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon in December, 2010.  It worked pretty well for about 18 months.  Then the battery compartment door started refusing to stay closed.  Apparently, a small piece of plastic that formed the latch had broken.  The camera had not been dropped or abused.  I believe it happened in the course of normal wear.  While I was happy with the camera in all other respects, I believe the battery door problem to be a serious design flaw, and that is the reason for my 1-star rating.  If you get one of these, handle the battery compartment door with kid gloves!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for my Purse!
Reviews.Author: Alexandria James
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, I was looking for a camera that would be easy to keep in my purse for those "Oh, I wish I had a camera!" moments. Knowing that Nikon makes very good cameras, I stumbled upon this one. It has been absolutely wonderful!! It takes wonderful pictures! I had an entire 32-ounce water bottle leak in my purse (the camera was very wet) and I've dropped my camera, but it still works! Well, the battery and card door broke when I dropped it and taping it worked for almost a year. Now the "tape-fix" suddenly stopped working, but all I have to do is hold the door closed when I snap a picture. I'm sure I'll buy a new camera soon as holding the door has gotten a bit annoying. However, I am still shocked that the camera has worked through both major incidents! If I do buy a new camera, I will be buying the exact same one (and making sure I don't drop it or have water near it!) because I LOVE this camera!!!I have taken scenic pictures, pictures in extreme conditions (like snow), pictures up close of myself and others (holding the camera out), and everything in between, and it takes fabulous pictures of everything! I have also used it to take a number of videos and they turn out really good as well!! This is a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Zoom Broken
Reviews.Author: C3inNJ
Reviews.Content: My father bought this camera new about a year ago for me and one for himself. After about a month of use, the zoom in and out feature stopped working. He claimed he didn't need to zoom much and switched cameras with me. Now, the zoom feature in the second camera has also stopped working.Because it takes great pics, is fast, light and easy to use, I gave it two stars, otherwise I would have given it one.At the end of the day it seems something is defective with the zoom feature - so beware.

Reviews.Title: jakenmaddie
Reviews.Author: jakenmaddie
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing this camera.  I did not get it through Amazon but Walmart.  The person working the electronics counter highly recommended the Nikon.  I needed a camera that day so went with his recommendation, but I have to say, all the negative reviews are totally true.  Blurry pictures (especially if you try to zoom).  Why have a zoom option if it won't take a clear picture?  I also had the same problem with the battery door.  The little plastic piece that is to hold the door shut broke off so now the only way to use the camera is by holding the door shut.  (And yes, I tried tape just to get me by until I could research other cameras, but that didn't work either).  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Frank's Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Cheri
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Nikon Coolpix L22 camera in an effort to replace my favorite simple to use Samsung camera because after thousands of amazing photos it finally gave out on me. This Nikon Coolpix camera has a lot more options, more zoom and all that than my old one and I didn't want all of that so gave it to my Frank.HE LOVES THIS CAMERA and thinks there is something wrong with me because I don't LOL........This camera takes great photos, it is small and easy to carry and has lots of options and settings.Service was great.Delivery prompt.I was going to send it back to purchase one like my old Samsung but Frank was so happy with it I didn't.I would highly recommend this camera for great shots, lots of options and reasonable pricing.May God blessCheri

Reviews.Title: do not buy; too many problems
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Hagerty "loyal customer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in June of 2010 and for the first year it was pretty good: you can carry it in your pocket, it takes great daytime photos; on the other hand, without good lighting you get either blurry photos(using natural light) or an overexposed look when you use the flash.  I still could have lived with all that given the price and the convenience.  However, the battery door started malfunctioning after about a year and wouldn't stay shut (I had to tape it).  Then, the zoom stopped working and the pictures were out of focus a lot of the time.  Finally, on a recent trip to Europe it kept totally shutting down and giving me the message "lens error."  Extremely frustating to the point thatI will avoid Nikon altogether from now on.

Reviews.Title: Not working a few months later
Reviews.Author: Meli "Meli"
Reviews.Content: I bought this in July 2010. It was great when it worked! A few months later, it stopped working. It was not damaged in any way, but it no longer turns on. In addition, the battery door does not open normally. This is actually the second Nikon I owned. I had bought a L18 that stopped working too. I will stop buying these affordable cameras. I would rather invest more money in something that won't break. Will be selling it for parts...

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L22 camera
Reviews.Author: Queen of Green
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! It makes me look like I know what I am doing. Taking pictures is really fun now, and I see things in a different way, because of this little point and shoot camera. I can get really clear close-ups of flowers and birds, that I could never get before. This camera has many features that I haven't even used yet, but I will continue to learn what this camera can do. It's a great little camera at a great price!

Reviews.Title: good bargain
Reviews.Author: rauwolfia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my Dad and he totally loves it. It is very easy to use and the picture quality is amazing. I have a very expensive camera for myself but this camera can complete with my expensive one at any time. The flash is amazing and I love the fact that it uses AA battery because its easier for my Dad to get new battery from any local store as soon as it runs down. It is a great camera compared to its price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jorge Polanco "JP"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera , fast deliver, no defects, fast taking pictures, not for professional or high quality sures, but pictures sure does looks great.

Reviews.Title: Batteries Fall OFF
Reviews.Author: MariaTeresa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my six year old who is very responsible and the first 7 months were good, but now we find ourselves with a Nikon Coolpix that drops the batteries since the back latch was poorly constructed with this design.  I've had my Panasonic camera for 15 years, and even though it is old, I've never experience this as with this Nikon Coolpix model.  I don't recommend this model.  Read reviews before you purchase a "disposable" Coolpix that will only last less than a year.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera great product excellent service delievered as promised would recommend to friends priced right recieved camera undamaged took 3-4 hrs of photos no problems at all

Reviews.Title: Garbage camera
Reviews.Author: Big Wally
Reviews.Content: I have owned 2 of these for about 2 years.Both have had the battery door break on them and now batteries are held in with tape.  The cam takes lousy pics even for a camera in this class.  Keep looking this thing is a piece of junk...

Reviews.Title: I like this camera
Reviews.Author: Healthy Hair Society "Healthy Hair Lady"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is simply amazing but for some reason I am having a very terrible time with the battery compartment.  It just does not want to stay closed.  Therefore, mine is taped for now.  But it still takes a very good picture.

Reviews.Title: Battery door will not stay closed
Reviews.Author: dondolson
Reviews.Content: I sent the camera back to nikon for warrenty but they would not repair it. The camera takes good pictures but I have to hold the battery door closed with tape. Will buy cannon next time they honor their warrenties

Reviews.Title: Good pictures for the price-- but very sensitive to any damage
Reviews.Author: Greg "gc"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures for it's price.  We bought one for our daughter, and she dropped it once and it broke.  Luckily it was under warranty so we had it repaired.  A few months later, it was knocked off a table and hit the ground again.  This time it is gone for good.Yes, I realize it is sensitive electronics, and that dropping it is prone to damage it.  Just a warning to beware if there's any chance it might happen at your house.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Janet C. Harris
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, it's easy to use and takes great pictures.  It also came with a user manual which I use.  I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: L22 Coolpix Nikon
Reviews.Author: John H. Bragg "JB"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife, who was planning a trip to Paris and needed a good quality, easy to use camera.  I have the exact same model which I have had for more than a year with absolutely no issues.  The camera works quite well, especially the close up macro feature.  However, someone dropped the camera and damaged the battery door, so now it looks like something found at a flea market.  To make it work, my wife tied a hair band of some kind around it.  It still takes great pictures, but just looks terrible. I have already read other reviews of the Nikon repair program and the associated costs, so I know I won't be repairing this unit.  At least it lasted for 6 days.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the picture quality of this camera.  I have always owned Nikon cameras and have been very happy with their optical quality, but not this camera.  If you use the zoom or the flash indoors, the pictures come out awful.  The only time I was happy with the photos I took were photos taken outside without zoom or flash.

Reviews.Title: Battery door defective!
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to warn people away from this sorry camera. The first time we used it was on vacation...the battery door broke (we used duct tape to keep it closed).  Also, it takes forever to focus (then it still will not take a picture).  Read the other reviews.........just don't buy this camera. Try the Cannon Powershot A1200 about eighty nine bucks and it has a viewfinder (we bought it on vacation to replace the Nikon). You can still use AA batteries with the Cannon and it fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Ehab A. Ali "stallion1824"
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this camera other than... Wow.  I did not expect such quality for the money I paid, even though it was advertised as "factory reconditioned", you might as well be buying a brand new camera.I highly recommend this product for anyone wanting a quality digital camera with all the bells and whistles for a price you can truly afford.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Louise M. Tucker "Consumer"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to finally have a Nikon digital camera.  Actually, mine is black, not red.  I purchased it the middle of August, 2010.  The pictures were good, but not great, but overall I was pleased with the camera at the beginning.  Well, it lasted all of one year and four months.  I didn't use the flash often, but each time I did I could only take about four pictures before it said "battery exhausted".  Last week, it finally died.  It won't turn on unless I put new batteries in it and the viewfinder is white and the camera won't turn off.  I have to remove the batteries to get it off.  It's the worst camera I've ever had.  I've read the manual and there are no answers for what it does (or doesn't do).  I've tried every battery under the sun and it still won't work.  I have an Aiptek that's about six years old that I paid $20 for and it works much better than the Nikon ever did.  Don't waste your money.  It's a real piece of junk.  Don't blieve all the hype about how good Nikon cameras are - I'll never buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Bad Bad
Reviews.Author: Ross W Borel
Reviews.Content: If you want blurry pictures this is the one to buy. Don't give it as a gift, It's embarrassing.Do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Clare
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year and a half ago for a special occasion.  My trustworthy cannon finally gave out after five years and I was short of extra discretionary funds.  So I searched for 'best point and shoot' around $100.  This model kept showing up.PROS - price - viewfinder - zoom - nice weight - double AA batteriesCONS - flash washes everything out (even with manual adjustments) - there is a long delay after taking picture - uses up those double A's very quicklyAND most importantly, the battery compartment lid won't stay shut.  Maybe it is from having to change the batteries so often?I HAVE RESORTED TO DUCT TAPE to keep it from popping open right when I'm about to take a picture.(yes, I have a nice camera case and no, I don't throw the thing on the ground or toss it around to see how much abuse it can take.  Although, part of me would like to.)The duct tape gives it a very special look -One would hope that, with all of the technological advances in digital photography, there would be a sturdy - easy to use - good quality photos - and affordable digital camera on the market.This one isn't it.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: abdullah al mamun
Reviews.Content: its very cheap.....digital cameraeasy to use......picture quality is also not bad....but u have to use aa batery.......not tooo slim.......

Reviews.Title: Superb for quick photos
Reviews.Author: Gary Friedland "THE CLASS MAVEN"
Reviews.Content: THIS NIKON CAMERA, L22 IS GREAT FOR QUICK SNAPSHOTS, EASY TO HANDLE AND MOSTIMPORTANTLY, DEPENDABLE AND IN THE TRUE TRADITION OF THE NIKON NAME FOR CLASSAND ACCURACY.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: S. Tortorelli
Reviews.Content: Product was very cheap.I was going to give it as a gift to my mom, but I returned it right away...Looks like a disposable camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Carla Manzo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is exactly what I wanted.  I love the pictures it takes.  I use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Another Broken Battery Latch
Reviews.Author: Kristen Smith "ksmith95"
Reviews.Content: As others have stated, the battery latch wouldn't stay shut on the Coolpix L22 we purchased back in Nov 2010. I sent it in to be fixed and Nikon said "If something is broken on the camera, it isn't covered under warrenty"  and wanted $72 to fix the camera.  I only paid $79 for it.  I told them that there were a ton of bad reviews and complaints about the same thing happening to this camera on Amazon.  I ended up having to speak to a supervisor and they said they'd take another look into it and get back to me.  They called back later saying they'd fix it for no cost.  Just an FYI for those of you who get the same thing.  Make sure you hassle with them til they fix it!

Reviews.Title: Pass on this junk
Reviews.Author: G. Peebles "Sawdust"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras, one for my wife and one for my grandaughter. Within 3 months the battery cover broke on both of them rendering both useless. The cost to get them repaired is almost the same as a new one.

Reviews.Title: Even with new batteries it doesn't work anymore!
Reviews.Author: Franz Bledl Santisteban
Reviews.Content: For the first months it worked perfectly, but then suddenly I cannot use it anymore. Even with fully charged or new batteries it only takes two or three photos and displays "battery exhausted" If I use the batteries in any other device they work without troubles. I hope I get a solution soon.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: Don't Buy It
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from another retailer the middle of Sept.I barely used it.. maybe three times at the most.Three weeks later, the little latch on the battery compartment was broke and will not stay closed long enough for me to get a picture. It seems I'm not the only one that this happened to now that I read the reviews (wish I had done that BEFORE I bought the camera!)What a bummer.I have a Nikon DSLR that has been AMAZING and is going on four years old so I was hoping to get the same Nikon quality here but, no go.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk!
Reviews.Author: Sunny Elias
Reviews.Content: When I saw this camera on sale, I thought, "Wow! What a bargain for only $79"! The store threw a case and a memory card with it. OK, that's great, saved me some money. But, however, when I took it home, I had a hard time opening the battery compartment. And this camera, Nikon Coolpix 22 eats batteries for breakfast, lunch and dinner! They drain really fast. The original batteries lasted not even a month, then I bought replacements - I'm talking Duracell, not a cheap brand, and the batteries were exhausted, and I just bought them brand new! Right in the middle if taking pictures, the camera shut down, and and to turn it on again. Even my cellphone camera works better than this crap.The only good feature of this poor excuse of a camera is that it takes good pictures. I thought Nikon made good quality cameras, but I'm wrong. I think I will check out Canons or Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Adam G MAresch
Reviews.Content: My first review for Amazon.  Anyway, this camera is junk.  Like other reviewers reported, the pictures taken are horrible-worse than a 'basic' cellphone camera.  The camera itself destroys pictures, with lines through some of the few pictures that are worth keeping, or cuts them off halfway.  It also makes 'collages' of a bunch of pictures.  What else doesn't it do?  It won't remember settings after it automatically goes to power saver mode.  It's slow to turn on and wake-up.  It makes a bunch of different Nikon 100 folders on the SDCard and distributes the pictures randomly.  It won't save some pictures, I've suspected that before but I now know there are a whole series of pictures just not there.  No way I'll ever get another chance to take those.Sorry Nikon, I'll never buy another product of yours.  Even though I expect perfection, or at least have the product live up to manufacturer claims; I very rarely post reviews.  This item is so bad that I have to.

Reviews.Title: Does not have rechargeable batteries
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recieved this camera as a gift and the first thing i found out was the fact that it did not come with a rechargeable battery which made be very unhappy. The camera itself is a good size but if i could return it i would have. When taking pictures it takes a while to get the picture into focus. I have missed really good shots because of this. The zoom feature is pretty good but other than that i wouldnt recomment this camera.

Reviews.Title: Shutter response is slow and focus unreliable
Reviews.Author: Gary Smith
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a shirt pocket camera for an upcoming trip and a local store had this on sale at a good price.  I usually buy Canon, but you can't go wrong with Nikon. Right?I suppose it is worth what I paid for it, but I am very disappointed and will probably soon replace it.My main complaints..and they are big ones with me..are that the shutter response time is very, very long.  After seeing a friend's amusing vacation pictures where he took pictures of companions jumping in midair in front of tourist attractions, we tried to do it with this camera...IMPOSSIBLE!Even with practice you cannot anticipate the jump and catch the people in the air. Not that I care to do that much...It just illustrates the point.My other main complaint is that in moderately low light...not poorly lit, just moderately low, the auto focus is very inaccurate resulting in as many out of focus pictures as in focus ones.I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: good value for point and shoot
Reviews.Author: tasha-kitty
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers mentioned slow shutter speed, and this is a problem in lower light settings - contributing to lots of fuzy photos.  However, is not as noticeable on exterior or well lit interior shots, but probably not a good choice if you are looking to do lots of action pictures. Battery life is not great, but only needs 2 batteries at a time (last point and shoot I had used 4 batteries at a time, but lasted forever). Only has the view screen and that can drain battery life.  Other downside of this camera is requires nikon proprietary cable to connect to your computer vs. standard mini USB connector. Not very expensive to get one, but hassle to have multiple cables.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: jjb09
Reviews.Content: I have this camera and I am very happy with it. it has sports mode which is great because I love taking pictures of fast movement.It takes .92 seconds with flash, and 1.34 seconds with no flashthere is 18 picture modes and it also records 25 minutes of video. About 5 hours of battery life. (takes 2 double A batteries) the one thing thatI don't like is how long it takes to delete. I wouldn't worry about that though.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera at a nice price
Reviews.Author: Jeff R. Granger "Team Granger"
Reviews.Content: My father always swore by his Nikon camera as it was the best. This model puts together some top end capabilities in a small price range, but it has a somewhat clunky and difficult to understand editing software (which I eventually gave up on and went back to my old standby Photoshop). Fortunately, it is very easy to save and import pictures so you can manipulate them in your choice of software, be it the software the comes with Windows, Apple, or something a little better like Photoshop.I don't especially recommend the included software package, as I found it less than helpful with things like cleaning up dark spots, moving small blemishes, and so on. It was also very unfriendly to a colorblind person.The camera will certainly require a good reading of the users manual as it is not quite a point and shoot, and certainly not intuitive. Than being said, in 20 minutes you can be up and running, and in 2 days, producing some pretty high quality shots with this camera. It has more than enough settings (probably too many in fact) to cover any occasion, and does quite well with a variety of distances.

Reviews.Title: Never took clear pictures, broke after 1 year of normal use
Reviews.Author: Bobbi Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera about a year and I've never been impressed with the quality of the pictures that came from it.  And the icing on the cake is that a small piece of plastic in the battery compartment has broken and the door that holds the batteries in no longer stays shut.  Not impressed with this Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!!
Reviews.Author: louise vaughn
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera!! It has so many awesome features and since I have gotten it, I have become quite the photographer. You will need to read the manual for some of the features and settings but, for most people, it is ready to go and ready to shoot right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Snuffles
Reviews.Content: I wanted a digital camera and I found this on Amazon.  It looked good and I decided to get it.  The camera works very well.  Its not the most Hi tech one but it does have a lot of features and it gets the job done.  I took it on a camping trip and got some great landscape photos

Reviews.Title: Slippery 'Lil thing!
Reviews.Author: Stephen L.
Reviews.Content: So I got this camera at BestBuy not on amazon but it's still the same camera. Anypoo -The Good:- Great Photos- Great Videos- Excellent Quality----------------------*I recommend this camera completely*The Bad:- Slippery as hell!!----------------------I do like the coding on this camera and the exquisite design - But it's slippery and that's why I do not have this camera today. Dropped it and broke it. (But i have butterfingers :-| ) If you have butterfingers and drop things easily, get a different camera because you most likely will drop it. I dropped it so hard it just didn't turn on anymore. I still have it but im too lazy to send it to Nikon.. If you buy this thing, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: NOT GOOD FOR REGULAR USE
Reviews.Author: David Kwan "Skitherockies"
Reviews.Content: The L22 takes great photos and AAA batteries are convenient.  I use mine a couple of times a week for photos of products to sell, but after only about 9 months, the battery door will no longer stay shut.  It also holds the SD card behind that door and the catch has worn out.  Nikon USA won't fix it under the 12 month factory warranty for free, they want $72.42 to fix it, LOL.  I will never buy a Nikon point and shoot again, nor will I recommend one to the many friends who ask me about which one to buy.  Back to Canon

Reviews.Title: Brand New Camera Stopped Working Shortly After Bought
Reviews.Author: Cat Lover
Reviews.Content: I had this camera only a few short months before the lens ceased to retract back into the camera.  This prevented me from being able to push the button for the camera to take pictures.  I hadn't even taken 50 pictures with this camera.  I called Nikon and explained the problem, and they ensured me that my camera repair would be covered under the 1-year warranty.  I mailed the camera back per their instructions at a cost of $15.00.  Imagine my surprise when a week later I received a letter that said "This repair is not covered under warranty."  They were asking me to approve a cost of $104.72 to repair it, and had the nerve to say in the letter that they would charge me more for the repair service "if the cost will exceed this estimate."  The camera was worth that amount new, so why would I pay that amount for a camera that failed me?  This was my first Nikon camera, and it will be my last.  So much for Nikon customer service...  I also want to add that I talked with several people at work who had Nikon's with a similar problem, and said Nikon also told them this problem is not covered under warranty.  Finally, I thought I was the only one taking bad photos until I just read that other people with Nikon's were having the same lousy washed out results from their flash photos.  Learn from us and buy from another manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool Pix L22
Reviews.Author: Patricia Ibbotson
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased in September 2010 on amazon.com and initially I liked it very much.  For an inexpensive camera it performed quite well. Flash photos at night were a problem and they tended to be underexposed. There were and are occasional automatic focus issues where the photos are blurry even if the camera is held steady.  Recently it started eating batteries and the battery case pops open at the most inconvenient times.  The lock is not broken but it is not strong enough to contain the batteries.  It is a real nuisance trying to take a photo and have the batteries fall out. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Fool proof camera
Reviews.Author: Construction Consultant
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. It performed excellently on the Appalachian Trail in Winter but had to keep the batteries warm in my pocket in sub zero temps. Operates on AA batteries which are easily found and they power the camera for a long time unless you leave the camera on by mistake - I did, once. Full instructions are on a disk with quick reference details in a thin paper manual. Disk had excellent wide ranging information so take time to familiarize this before leaving unless you are taking a reader with you - I wasn't. Camera comes with a lead for connecting to a computer but you do need to buy a chip to record photos- camera will only record a few without one. This you can plug into a printer to produce hard copies. Never used the video option nor needed customer support which has always been excellent in the past. Bought the little blue case which kept the camera clean and protected. Never had any of the problems mentioned by other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Hardy Thompson "Elizabeth Hardy Tho...
Reviews.Content: Got this December 2010 and the battery door latch is broken...poor quality. Almost immediately after I bought it the zoom button is intermittent. Now it goes to video on its own. I'm assuming there is a software glitch or the internal hardware is far from robust. Poor design, poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: shoes
Reviews.Content: Camera was a gift and a good value. Have had no issues with it since Christmas. Could spend more and get more functions, but this is a good starter.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Cathey Burrell
Reviews.Content: The nikon coolpix is a great buy if you want somehing not too expensive but that still has good resolution.  12mp is very impressive and gives professional quality clarity.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: E. Jordan
Reviews.Content: Nice, durable camera well suited for point and shoot and especially good for children.  Has different features for taking photos such as different modes to put it in.  My only issue with it is that for children to use they need to be taught to hold it VERY still when snapping the photo or the photo is blurry.  Other than that it is a good camera.  We used rechargeable batteries in it and that works well.

Reviews.Title: ok camera
Reviews.Author: mrmanlyman
Reviews.Content: i use this camera for family photos and vacations, it works good for those proposes but it doesnt have great zoom, and if your into photography then you should look at a diffrent camera. overall good camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Content: I get my camera and it's really great, I had no problems with it and I recommend the product. The nikon Coolpix L22 is an awesome and useful camera.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a little more than a year. After a year and one month it broke. The focus stopped working, either auto or manual. If you consider buying this camera be prepared to through it in the garbage soon or pay for ridiculously expensive extended warranty. Strictly not recommend.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jamie Bourgeois
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this camera. This camera is the perfect size for my purse. I can carry it where ever I go. It is easy to carry around and user friendly. I use it mostly to take picture of flowers. The pictures came out beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Shnip1
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my wife and she likes it. If you knew my wife that is high praise. My daughter takes it and uses it herself. Again High praise.

Reviews.Title: Warranty Issues
Reviews.Author: jane doe
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in Sept 2010.  Like the camera, takes great pics.  However, the battery door won't stay closed.  Returned camera to Nikon for warranty repair. They insist camera was dropped (never, always in case when not in use) or battery door forcibly opened causing it to break. (how??) They told me warranty only covers camera if it doesn't work when it is taken out of the box.  It does not cover issues that arise after camera has been used. Anyway, they want $56 to repair battery door and $20 tax, shipping, handling for a total of $76 to repair a $90 camera.  If you buy this camera, be VERY CAREFUL with it because Nikon will not repair under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Botany
Reviews.Content: After researching digital cameras, I purchased the Coolpix because of what I had read.  It is a great little camera.  The delivery time was good and the camera came with it's original owner's manual, etc.  It was a great purchase for me!

Reviews.Title: geat for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Morris "astronomy man"
Reviews.Content: Ive only had this camera for a few weeks,but so far the pictures are very sharp as well as the video. I paid 69 dollars for this used camera,which looks and works like brand new.I cant find anything wrong with it and the lcd screen is very easy to see even on a bright sunny day.

Reviews.Title: battery cover
Reviews.Author: J. O'Dea "J.B.O."
Reviews.Content: I am needing to replace a Coolpix L20 because the battery door broke.  I will not buy a coolpix online, until I get a look at one in a store to see if they have fixed the very weak design.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Detra Dangelo "Agent DD"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 60 year old mother hoping it would prove easy to use and non-intimidating. It was perfect for her. She loved the look of it, how small it is and the large viewing screen. She was able to load the software and start using it immediately without any reference to the user manuals. Picture quality was great, too. Haven't gotten into the more advanced features but for an entry level introduction to digital photography this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Poor rating
Reviews.Author: kein
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red-primary)This is the camera I purchased BUT after a month, started to take horrible pictures.  It is obviously related to the flash that no longer works.  I am in the process of returning this to the vendor (Tech for Less) who sold it to me.  The problem with purchasing from Amazon is that the returns are more difficult than taking the product back to the local Best Buy for a refund or new camera.So far, I have had no other negative experiences purchasing from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Bingaman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to the high rating in Consumer's Report.  I have been very impressed with the results.  The camera is small and lightweight but takes excellent pictures including low light and fast moving subjects.I like the fact that you can override automatic settings if you want and the auto bracketing features that ensures the subject you want to take a photo of is in focus.  ( The camera, somehow, is able to tell where the faces of people are )

Reviews.Title: Just take your money and throw it directly into the garbage
Reviews.Author: RL "RL"
Reviews.Content: It's dead.  Focus problems from the day I got it and one day, the lens just stopped working.  I can't imagine how anyone has had a good experience with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Margaret R Meadows
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for a young adult. My granddaugher is 11 and will be going camping out west for 3 weeks. I purchased this for her and it takes great pictures and is easy to handle, since that was her request. She is very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: good cam
Reviews.Author: ananth
Reviews.Content: a very good cam for its price range. it should satisfy any normal person for some fun and quick shots

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: The camera works as promised and I'm pleased with the pictures. The menus are not very intuitive, but with patience I'm figuring everything out. The only thing I don't really like is that the printed manual is only enough to get you started; the full manual needs to be loaded from the CD onto your computer. This is a bit inconvenient because I usually need it in the field as questions come up during use, but I understand in this day and age everything is as digital as possible. I'll adapt. Other than that, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: kinkeruno
Reviews.Content: Good camera. But the image quality is not the best. More than half the pictures I take come out blurry.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy this
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I thought it was an inexpensive, yet effective camera like the Cannon I had beforehand (and had to part with...)But it is only cheap, not effective. Here is why:- The zoom broke after one month for no apparent reason- The sound of the videos is very soft even if you set the volume at max- Pictures in doors are very yellowish if you dont use flesh (compared with the Cannon that would do a better job even with in door lights). The indoor setting does nothing to help.- Takes forever to shoot- Eats batteries faster than the Cannon I had.I am looking for a new camera now...

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste Your Money!
Reviews.Author: S. Shaw
Reviews.Content: I bought mine after Christmas. Immediately the zoom out stopped working. Now the zoom in/zoom out doesn't work at all. To make it completely unusable, the latch broke when I was changing the batteries. I keep my camera in a case at all times and am protective of my things. I've sent it to be serviced but wish I just would have gone with another camera. As my first Nikon, I am not impressed.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I love the camera....it would have been more perfect if a camera case, a plastic cover for the screen and a photo disk was included in the package!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, but with cheap parts
Reviews.Author: Sarbari and Andreas Rothe
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, perfect for my 8 year old.However, the battery latch breaks easily, since cheap plastic parts are being used. Will costs another $20 or so to repair it.

Reviews.Title: Good for its price
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Landry
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace the Nikon I dropped and broke.  This camera is a less advanced version than the one I broke.  It's not a great camera, but it is definitely a good camera for the price.  I have no complaints.  If I wanted more features, etc., I would have bought a higher model, but I needed a camera in a hurry, and it was available and affordable.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a basic, point-and-shoot digital camera.

Reviews.Title: coolpix  Nikon
Reviews.Author: Marcia B. Graff
Reviews.Content: I sent this as a present and heard great comments about this camera; I was especially pleased that it arrived so quickly-in 2 o3 days. I have seen the pictures via email and they are sharp and clear. I am pleased vicariously with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Been very pleased with this little camera.  It fits  - and has survived well (inside a good case)- in my purse where it lives as I need to be able to take pictures of the community I work in as needed.  The video feature works better than I expected including good audio. I'm not a photo expert so this works great in its simplicity and can't beat the price point on it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but night mode needs improvement
Reviews.Author: Ria
Reviews.Content: I wanted to gift my parents and bought this as it would be easy to use. I have found no problems in general with this camera except for the night mode. Pictures taken at night are blurry. Pictures taken in a not-well-lit area appear very dark.Summary: Easy to use but not a very good night camera.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot, AA battery, and SD card.
Reviews.Author: MantisX
Reviews.Content: The only thing I love more than a camera that doesn't take proprietary batteries is a camera that takes excellent pictures.  That's why I love my point and shoot L22.  Yeah, sometimes the auto mode gets it wrong but you don't have to run it in full auto all the time.  SD cards are more standard nowadays too.  You can get a huge one for next to nothing.  That's why I love this camera.  Small, light weight, non-proprietary, 4or8gb card for tons of pictures, and rechargeable AA batteries.  Try taking photos at your friends wedding with your lithium-ion battery that is dead and nowhere to charge it!  There is always a convenience store nearby if you need AA batteries in a bind.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: LB2309Z
Reviews.Content: This camera takes VERY high quality photos even with my using 5 megapixels instead of the 12. The colors are true to life and I am always impressed by the photos. It's user-friendly and straightforward so it works well for a beginner. On the downside, it uses up a lot of AA batteries in a very short time but it's still worth it in my opinion. I have read reviews on amazon and have ordered eneloop rechargable AA batteries for this camera. Hope it helps!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L22 from Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Peggy K. Sequeira
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for me. I am older and this camera is easy to use and produces good pictures. Easy to use apps and large picture window. I like this camera very much.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for non-professionals
Reviews.Author: M. Prado "mpd10"
Reviews.Content: I bought these camera since my Sony has been having problems later and I'm going on vacation and want to take a lot of photos. The camera is not heavy at all. I love the big screen. The plastic feels a little cheap but this is a cheap camera so I can't complain. I've taken some pictures indoor and outdoor and I'm happy with them. I'm not a professional photograph and I dont have any knowledge of photography but I think for a regular person this camera would work. It's my first day with the camera, so if I have any problems with it, I'll certainly post it. I cant think I could have bought a better camera for the price ($80).

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: Nikon_Camera
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera for the price, bought 4 of the Nikon Coolpix L22 12.0MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: In love with this camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: I am in absolute love with this camera! My old one, which I had for about 6 years finally went on the brink after being dragged all over the world. I  bought this one for a third of the price as my last one! I've been taking wonderful pictures in the tropics of the Philippines with it and I couldn't want for a better camera. So easy to use, high picture quality, light weight. No complaints! Oh, and it shipped quickly as well! I had it three days after ordering it!

Reviews.Title: drop on a carpet and by by camera
Reviews.Author: Cthruitall "deadali"
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera because i previously had a coolpix that was easy to use and i liked the pictures.  This camera was also easy to use and took nice pics.  However, I only had the camera a few months and i dropped it from arm's length onto a carpet and it broke. Since it had a warranty, I sent it in to Coolpix for fixing.  They wanted to charge me as much as i piad for the camera to have it fixed.  They sent it back unfixed.  I vowed never to buy another coolpix...sorry but a camera should not break if it falls onto a carpet one time.  I bought a lumix to replace it.  the lumix by panasonic was less money and guess what..i dropped that in a 2 foot pool of water ... and it recovered and is working again.  This camera is as easy to use as the coolpix and it takes just as nice pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L22
Reviews.Author: Lynn A. Goodell "Lynnie"
Reviews.Content: I read online reviews of this camera after I ordered it and was concerned, but I love the camera.  Changing settings and using it has been very easy.  I have a habit of moving my other camera at the moment of pressing the shutter, but don't seem to have as great a problem with the Coolpix...few blurry pictures which was a review problem comment.  The pictures are clear with great color and the movie I took of my new grandson came out wonderful.  I think it's a great camera for taking family, vacation, etc. pictures. I originally bought it with the thought of giving it to my son, but I'm keeping it for myself and handing down my old camera to him! With taking pictures of a newborn, it's important to easily turn off the flash and it's very simple to do so.  I think this is a great camera for the average home photographer.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point-and-Shoot Digital for Price
Reviews.Author: Goldie
Reviews.Content: Nice little PAS digital camera for the very reasonable price.  We purchased this camera for each of our tween daughters (10 and 12) to get away from using disposables that cost around $14 per camera to develop!  It has given them freedom to take as many pictures as they want and view them immediately while using the camera's features for special effects.  Since they're still children, we didn't want to spend too much money on a starter camera, but we wanted a decent camera that takes nice pictures at a good pricepoint.  So far, we have been very pleased.  As for durability, I can't honestly speak to that since we've only had the cameras for about a month (and they haven't yet been dropped), but everything is in good working order at the moment.  Transferring pictures to computer is easy, too! I would recommend this product after personal experience and reading the reviews on many competitors' models at the same pricepoint.

Reviews.Title: hated it
Reviews.Author: Cinda
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas.  Extremely disappointed.  Most of my pics turn out blurry, or a crazy color- like yellowish on inside pics with flash.  I have tried multiple different settings.  It is just awful.  I have had it too long to return it- kept thinking I would figure out how to make it take good pictures, as I have never had this problem before- it is a  point and shoot camera after all!  I will be buying a new one, and probably a cannon, as I LOVED my old one.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera as a Gift for first time users
Reviews.Author: S. S. Sinha "Siddhartha"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for one of my relative as a gift. This will be his first ever digital camera so I think he will absolutely like it. Before this one I bought several digital cameras one dslr and I think within this price range this camera is awesome. I paid almost 9 times more than this camera on 2004 for a Konica Minolta and with less features and quality. I bought a Sony DCS-TX5 just 2 months ago and paid 4 times more price than this one but this Nikon Coolpix camera beats Sony DSX-TX5 by picture quality wise. I just took 3-4 shot at night so far just for testing but I am impressed with the quality of picture.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Author: swecha
Reviews.Content: picture quality was not satisfactory...requires two AA bateries which we meeds to be replaced with new ones every now and then. I would rathers spend few more bucks and get a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Godzdude
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I was looking for, and was priced where I could afford it.  I have taken several hundred pictures with it in the short time I've had it, and am extremely happy.

Reviews.Title: Very satisified with the camera
Reviews.Author: zachery7
Reviews.Content: I just want to thank you for having this camera in stock and it's exactly what I was looking for. I am very pleased with everything and it was sent to me so quickly. I apologize it took me so long to write you, the last few months have been kinda crazy but finally getting this in.Thank you again,Zachery Spencer

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: DJC
Reviews.Content: We really love this camera. We had one that was stolen and didn't even look at anything else because we enjoy this camera so much. It's compact, batteries last a long time, pictures are great. Can't think of anything about it we don't like.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: Salvidali "bookindian"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Coolpix mainly because I needed high resolution images on occasion, its a great camera, BUT, I have an iPod Touch 4G that I use almost exclusively. The reason that the Nikon sits in the backseat is: it doesn't have all the apps that can be added to the iPod Touch, simply, even with the low resolution images, the iTouch is better suited to the documentary style of work that I do. Worth the $$$ spent, but it doesn't let me enter text, e-mail, or post on my blog. If you want a very good "camera", GET one, Nikon Coolpix, that is . . .

Reviews.Title: very user friendly
Reviews.Author: Lady Bligh
Reviews.Content: I have an older version of this camera.  I bought this one for my father because of how much I liked mine.  He had never used a digital camera before but didn't have much trouble figuring out how to use all the features.  If I had one complaint, the buttons are very small and he has to put glasses on to see what he's pushing, but I suppose that's the sacrifice you make for a compact item.
